Do not record the repo as needing to be tracked for the proposal
script if there are no changes.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I2468719d194af09dd7048015f173b0335f64371f

subject: Send disk_over_commit if nova api < 2.25
messages: [{'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-07-25 01:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-04 08:31:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-05 14:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 01:19:08.000000000', 'message': 'Send disk_over_commit if nova api < 2.25

Previously, disk_over_commit was not exposed and was defaulted to
False. At least one future SDK user (openstackclient) will need
disk_over_commit support from the SDK. This patch adds
disk_over_commit to the live_migrate parameters, and sends it to the
server if running with api < 2.25.

Change-Id: I3f1c6eab41432b9db79ad147cfac3ff63eb70efa
Story: #2002963
Task: #23177
'}]
commit_message:
Send disk_over_commit if nova api < 2.25

Previously, disk_over_commit was not exposed and was defaulted to
False. At least one future SDK user (openstackclient) will need
disk_over_commit support from the SDK. This patch adds
disk_over_commit to the live_migrate parameters, and sends it to the
server if running with api < 2.25.

Change-Id: I3f1c6eab41432b9db79ad147cfac3ff63eb70efa
Story: #2002963
Task: #23177

commit_message:
Handle exceptions in initial convergence traversal setup

If an exception occurs while doing the initial setup of a convergence
traversal (including sending the check_resource messages for leaf nodes),
mark the stack as failed. If we don't do this then any error or exception
in this method will cause the stack to hang IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: Ib8231321e823634a3dc23cff9a1c7d560f64fd6e
Story: #2003125
Task: 23245

subject: Check with previous status when delete nested stack
messages:
[{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-09-29 08:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-09-29 14:58:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There's a certain danger in this because afaict the updated_at time is not changed when we go DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. So if the nested stack was in the DELETE_FAILED state, and a subseqent delete also failed very quickly (i.e. before we see DELETE_IN_PROGRESS), then we'll never recognise that the delete has started and it will just hang until the timeout."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-09-30 09:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I through we change it at [1]?
[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/stack.py#L1270'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-10-03 21:56:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Check with previous status when delete nested stack

Add previous status for deleting stack resource and use it to
check against current status. This will help to reduce some chances
of race condition (like when we check status with stack status and
find it failed when actual action not yet setting the status for
new action).
Also to avoid checking against a already in deleted stack
(like delete the child stack first in nested stack), we should just
mark as complete when we find the stack status is delete complete.
Story: #1669608
Task: #17214

Change-Id: Ie4542d7b20a3b1ba7ebe853408419418bd1ee194

Log traceback on errors in Watcher

This commit makes sure exception is logged with traceback when an error
happened in Watcher (e.g. when processing the event).

commit_message:
remove project block when empty

If we remove all of the templates and jobs for a project, do not leave
the empty project block behind.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

During a gate test I discovered that the ssh key wasn't
generated in /root/.ssh but /home/zuul - causing an error.
This will create the key in the home directory of the user.

Change-Id: Ic095d0d05342c93f6be52b7f44bf2082d2556780
"}, {'created': '2018-08-03 20:36:20.000000000', 'message': "ssh-key should land in $HOME

commit_message:
ssh-key should land in $HOME

During a gate test I discovered that the ssh key wasn't
generated in /root/.ssh but /home/zuul - causing an error.
This will create the key in the home directory of the user.

Change-Id: Ic095d0d05342c93f6be52b7f44bf2082d2556780

commit_message:
Fix lxc image preparation for bionic

Ensure that the devices required for apt are present. Ensure
that the required directories for gpg-agent are present. Ensure
that the gpg-agent is running.

Change-Id: Iaa82d44c041ca5f83e6ba7b99af3dfacef8af369
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I0b329814ee4833f315214213c0d72ee927ca7e7d
Story: #2003250

- gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial/5bae8b8/ : SUCCESS in 49m 24s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-py35-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-py35-ubuntu-xenial/a4b78da/ : SUCCESS in 1h 02m 59s
- gate-nova-tox-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-nova-tox-functional-ubuntu-xenial/9aa30d3/ : SUCCESS in 17m 53s
- gate-nova-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-nova-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial/b32ce25/ : SUCCESS in 17m 53s
- gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-ubuntu-xenial/2dacfc4/ : SUCCESS in 42m 26s
- gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration-nv http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration-nv/df578ab/ : SUCCESS in 38m 03s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-cells-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-cells-ubuntu-xenial/a9a1f5d/ : SUCCESS in 41m 31s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial/ad86798/ : SUCCESS in 1h 05m 04s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/9768b27/ : SUCCESS in 1h 13m 28s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-nova-next-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-nova-next-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/314691c/ : SUCCESS in 1h 17m 54s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration-ubuntu-xenial/967b64b/ : SUCCESS in 24m 33s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/26/442126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial-nv/46177da/ : SUCCESS in 38m 46s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-03-07 11:23:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I feel like this feature is too similar to the existing sparse LVs feature. I'd like to see an argument that it's worth using thin lvs over sparse lvs, and if so we should switch. It's already expensive enough to test regular LVM and I don't think we're even testing sparse LVM, so adding yet another option isn't attractive to developers, operators, or our CI infrastructure.

That's not to say I'm against using thin pools, but Nova can afford to be opinionated here. Lets pick 1 approach and do that, deprecating sparse if necessary.

Incidentally, I'd also want to see a discussion of how we expect the thin pool to be managed. Is there any reason Nova can't do that? We don't want to be pushing things out to the operator/installer without thinking it through."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-07 23:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

One possible reason for using thin pools is to enable very efficient resizes to the same host.  Rather than copying the contents of the volume you can just do an LVM snapshot, which is very quick since both volumes use the same underlying data in a copy-on-write way.

For what it's worth, internally we added a "thinpool_suffix" option which determines the name of the thin pool given the name of the volume group.  At nova-compute startup if the thin pool doesn't exist we create it.  We do like cinder and use 95% of the free space when making the thin pool.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-03-08 10:10:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Chris, that sounds great. My quick reading on the topic seemed to suggest that thin pools was the way the developers want us to do this.

So, how about we ditch the thinpool config variable, use a thinpool whenever sparse is specified, and have Nova manage the thinpool as Chris suggests? I think the biggest issue would be migrating instances from old to new layout.

If we don't want to do that, though, I'm not keen on supporting 2 different ways of doing almost exactly the same thing."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-08 15:42:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Actually, we're in a bit of luck because currently we don't support migration for LVM-backed disks.  (Which is something else we might want to fix.)"}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-03-08 16:01:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Overloading of 'migrate' there. I mean convert sparse to thinpool in place."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-08 17:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ew...I don't think we'd want to convert them in-place...that'd be like converting in-place between qcow2 and LVM.  I mean, I suppose you could do it as an offline thing with the instances all not running, but that seems more like an operator procedure.

I think the "proper" procedure would be to introduce a new option and deprecate "sparse" for removal in Q or R.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-03-08 17:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The issue is that we've (presumably) got instances using sparse now. This means we can't deprecate sparse unless we can move them to something new. If we don't deprecate sparse we're left supporting 2 very similar things indefinitely. IOW, now or later conversion is a thing.

Incidentally, we're going to have to face this in other contexts, too. I've had an ideal for some time now to storage driver-specific metadata in the bdm of each disk. This will allow us to know unambiguously what backend a disk is using, which will also faciliate storage changes like this one."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-08 18:11:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

How would you do the in-place change?  You can't do it while the instance is running, so would you do it automatically on instance stop?  That seems kludgy.

A rebuild might work, but then you lose your user data.  We can't migrate LVM-backed instances, so that doesn't work.

Fundamentally LVM is a poorly-supported backend, and unless we add additional capabilities it's going to require operator intervention to switch from sparse to thin.  (I'm not even sure it's possible to convert a sparse volume to a still-sparse thin volume.)

Incidentally, with recent-ish LVM tooling I'm told that a sparse volume actually silently makes a separate thinpool behind the scenes, but older tooling behaved differently.  (See a thread I started at https://www.redhat.com/archives/linux-lvm/2015-October/msg00006.html)"}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-03-08 18:16:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

All good questions, and I don't have answers. However, I'd like to have answers before heading down this road."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-03-09 16:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> Incidentally, with recent-ish LVM tooling I'm told that a sparse
 > volume actually silently makes a separate thinpool behind the
 > scenes, but older tooling behaved differently.  (See a thread I
 > started at https://www.redhat.com/archives/linux-lvm/2015-October/msg00006.html)

So this means that today we can have the following volumes in the same VG :

- Sparse volumes created using /dev/zero snapshots

  sparse_segtype_default = "snapshot"
  
- Sparse volumes created using the default named thin pools (lvolN)

  sparse_segtype_default = "thin"

Having both types in the same pool isn't an issue [1] so I don't see the need for migrating existing volumes into this new thin pool format using custom pool names. We should just deprecate CONF.libvirt.sparse_logical_volumes for removal and introduce the new custom thin pool creation code. If operators want to migrate existing volumes into these pools these can do so outside of Nova.

Any reason for this not being written up in a full spec btw?

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/602087/'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-09 16:42:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

One issue is that if we go to thinpool-backed then ideally we would want to create a single large thinpool and change the disk accounting to look at how much space is available in the thinpool rather than in the VG.  If we have a thinpool as well as various sparse volumes (backed by /dev/zero or by their own thinpools) then it's going to be tricky to get an accurate accounting of free space."}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-03-09 16:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

IIRC thin LVs have a different path? i.e. they're <thin pool>/<vol name> instead of just <vol name>, no? This means we have to refer to them differently, and therefore support both.

+1 on the spec, btw.

I'd also favour simply re-purposing the existing config variable rather than deprecating them and adding new ones."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-03-09 16:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> One issue is that if we go to thinpool-backed then ideally we would
 > want to create a single large thinpool and change the disk
 > accounting to look at how much space is available in the thinpool
 > rather than in the VG.  If we have a thinpool as well as various
 > sparse volumes (backed by /dev/zero or by their own thinpools) then
 > it's going to be tricky to get an accurate accounting of free
 > space.

I don't think that's going to be tricky, we already have the logic to work out the space taken up by both types in the VG between the existing code and this change. The fact that we don't have this in place today is a bug anyway as we could and possibly do have users with both types in the same VG already.

 > IIRC thin LVs have a different path? i.e. they're <thin pool>/<vol
 > name> instead of just <vol name>, no? This means we have to refer
 > to them differently, and therefore support both.

Checking locally and as listed in my previous example it looks like $vg/$lv can still be used.

 > I'd also favour simply re-purposing the existing config variable
 > rather than deprecating them and adding new ones.

We would potentially want a new config option for the thin pool name but yeah happy to avoid config churn if we can."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-09 17:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

"I don't think that's going to be tricky, we already have the logic to work out the space taken up by both types in the VG between the existing code and this change. The fact that we don't have this in place today is a bug anyway as we could and possibly do have users with both types in the same VG already."

Currently we just look at the free space in the VG as reported by the "vgs" command.  If we move to a single large thinpool then we'd want to calculate the "free" space relative to the thinpool instead of the VG.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2017-03-09 18:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks.. lots of insightful reviews. I have had some ops-related issues to handle the last several days (still ongoing) so that has limited my participation in the discussion. It does seem like a spec makes the most sense to hash out how the thin LVs should be done in Nova.

 > Currently we just look at the free space in the VG as reported by
 > the "vgs" command.  If we move to a single large thinpool then we'd
 > want to calculate the "free" space relative to the thinpool instead
 > of the VG.

This is done in the current patch when thin pools are used. There should not be any conflict with sparse since the thin-pools have their extents pre-allocated based on the size of the thinpool LV. This is the main (appealing for me) difference from sparse volumes. As currently implemented in Nova if I understand correctly, sparse volumes pre-allocate 64MB and then count on LVM monitor to extend the sparse volume as it reaches certain utilization thresholds.

LVM monitor being broken or disabled is not uncommon on many distros I've seen so the sparse volumes can become pretty high maintenance. Thin pools seem smoother operationally because I have the ability to pre-allocate a large pool of extents and allow the thin provisioned LVs to grow/TRIM within the thin pool without any LVM monitor intervention.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-03-09 18:38:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

My point was that if we have a mix of old-style sparse and new-style thinpool-backed volumes, calculating the free/total space becomes a bit trickier.  The old way just looked at free/total space in the VG, but if we have a single thinpool we'd want to look at free space in the thinpool, but total space would have to account for the sparse volumes as well.

Once we delete the instances using old-style sparse volumes, would nova try to lvextend the thinpool to make use of the freed-up space?

I suppose the above is doable..it might actually be possible to do a gradual in-place conversion from old-style to new-style."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-05-22 10:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2017-08-01 09:54:24.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and is not mergable in it's current state. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2017-08-01 09:54:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and is not mergable in it's current state. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-04 20:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looking over the starlingx-staging/stx-nova repo changes at their support for thinly provision LVMs, and came across this blueprint/change, and also now noting that sparse LVM support in nova is deprecated:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#libvirt.sparse_logical_volumes'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-04 20:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Deprecated sparse_logical_volumes in Rocky: I6f05bb32313de1d832fe080c00a74508224acd77'}]

commit_message:
Add LVM thin pool support

Allow the LVM image backend to support specification of an LVM
thin pool, which can be used along with the volume group name
to thin provision logical volume extents when creating new
logvols.

Implements: blueprint lvm-thin-pool
Change-Id: I8f42659bb076ef6fb2ae7805026f891926be6676

Keystone: Stop running keystone container with root user

This PS updates the keystoen chart to stop running the keystone api
as the root user.

Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
clarify usage of upgrade_levels group

clarify usage of upgrade_levels group especially to note
other than upgrade_levels.compute that can't use 'auto'.

Closes-Bug: 1781916

Change-Id: I23ae3895d63a4f6aa40b4a17822270da7cd5b9e3

commit_message:
Use an absolute path for the role requirements file

Instead of providing the file lookup plugin with a relative path,
which it uses to search a variety of different paths, we can provide
an absolute path to the role requirements file based on the playbook
location.

Change-Id: Ie8452a1ed491acd5f846e2cd6cacba13dbd9f5b9

[{'created': '2018-07-12 15:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'Move get-ansible-role-requirements to scripts

This playbook is the default clone method for roles in both testing
and production. It originally started as a tests-only role fetcher,
so it belonged in tests then, but now that it is used by default
it should reside in scripts.

Also remove an unnecessary reference to the test-inventory.ini,
since the contents of test-inventory.ini are the contents of the
default base ansible inventory if none is provided (meaning
test-inventory.ini is generally redundant.)

Change-Id: I47628f678098b283526e4fc6204520d85046a512

commit_message:
Move get-ansible-role-requirements to scripts

This playbook is the default clone method for roles in both testing
and production. It originally started as a tests-only role fetcher,
so it belonged in tests then, but now that it is used by default
it should reside in scripts.

Also remove an unnecessary reference to the test-inventory.ini,
since the contents of test-inventory.ini are the contents of the
default base ansible inventory if none is provided (meaning
test-inventory.ini is generally redundant.)

Change-Id: I47628f678098b283526e4fc6204520d85046a512

messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-26 18:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-26 18:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-26 18:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-26 18:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-26 18:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-26 19:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

could somebody take this over? This is more involved than expected but should give you a start...'}, {'account_id': 25575, 'date': '2018-04-18 05:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hello, Andreas

Thank you for support.
For now, the l3 services are broken in the latest version of OpenStack. To make it pass the test, we need to also fixed the l3 services parts. However, l3 services are not used and updated any more.
Currently, only SONA project is using the networking-onos and we have been managing the latest networking-onos codes in sona-project github.
https://github.com/sonaproject/networking-onos

Now, I am trying to merge the changes to the official OpenStack branch, removing all l3 services parts, which are not used any more.
I will do it ASAP.

Thank you,

Sangho'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-04 16:54:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Follow neutron api changes

Follow change Ice49572e217eeaf820e48d40f2251d08766490b5 in moving
the driver_api to neutron_lib api to fix builds.

Also, use constants from neutron_lib, this moved as well.

Change-Id: I964d3381a7011f0ab95c7c89b54c2e05d933c2ff

commit_message:
Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role
to use the project-template instead.

Set newly introduced failing jobs as non voting.

Change-Id: Ib452cf8b23dd48b95def4f306b6df134ff278419

subject: Remove inventory path for group/host_vars
messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-11 04:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-11 07:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is not needed anymore, as we don't have the vars_plugin anymore.

See the removal here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580368/3/scripts/openstack-ansible.rc"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-25 12:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-08-04 15:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

already fixed elsewhere.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 04:13:06.000000000', 'message': 'Correct inventory path for group/host_vars

The group/host_vars path in the rc file was not being effectively
updated resulting in a situation where static inventory was not working
as expected with the openstack-ansible command like utility. This change
simply corrects the pathing allowing static inventory to work as
expected.

Change-Id: Id7d6adf8b157537e7171b6cb61608a56c70f43d8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 17:00:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove inventory path for group/host_vars

The group/host_vars path is no longer used, so we delete it.

Change-Id: Id7d6adf8b157537e7171b6cb61608a56c70f43d8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove inventory path for group/host_vars

The group/host_vars path is no longer used, so we delete it.

Change-Id: Id7d6adf8b157537e7171b6cb61608a56c70f43d8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix filter style consistency for keystone assignment API
messages: [{'account_id': 15699, 'date': '2018-05-22 05:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-04 08:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-04 14:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-22 05:55:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix filter style consistency for keystone assignment API

This patch adds the '_' version of filters back along with
'.' version of filters for role assignment list API to make
it consistent with others APIs of keystone.

Change-Id: If15f314ddfbdd0af6ee68529cea4c7161e7a8e0c
Closes-Bug: #1755056
"}]
commit_message:
Fix filter style consistency for keystone assignment API

This patch adds the '_' version of filters back along with
'.' version of filters for role assignment list API to make
it consistent with others APIs of keystone.

Change-Id: If15f314ddfbdd0af6ee68529cea4c7161e7a8e0c
Closes-Bug: #1755056

commit_message:
Sets correct permission for /etc/hosts

presently while genearting the hosts file and
replacing the original one , the file permission is
replaced  with no access for world and ownership
changes from root to centos.

Secondary nodes, in the cluster while trying to
resolve primary host address can't  read the host
name and ip from hosts file and fails to connect.

This fix restores the hosts file permission correctly

Change-Id: Ia9b7e609644c93d13108af88aa3dacf94fc19ceb
Task: #23261
Story: #2003139

commit_message:
Remove the molteniron service from the integrated build

The molteniron service appears to be largely for testing purposes
and both the service and role have not had much activity for over
a year. As such, it is removed from OSA's integrated build.

Change-Id: I94b1be326935f7006027b4a437ff3b2b0a6f9a69

subject: Use repo_build_pip_default_index for the pypi fallback
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 16:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'Use repo_build_pip_default_index for the pypi fallback

For offline installs, or when using local mirrors, the
variable repo_build_pip_default_index will be set to the
local pypi mirror.

Instead of falling back to pypi, we should fall back to
whatever the repo build is set to use. This gives a more
consistent and user-friendly experience.

Change-Id: Iddac2cc46aa1eb1466ef9e956c01618ef4deac99
'}]
commit_message:
Use repo_build_pip_default_index for the pypi fallback

For offline installs, or when using local mirrors, the
variable repo_build_pip_default_index will be set to the
local pypi mirror.

Instead of falling back to pypi, we should fall back to
whatever the repo build is set to use. This gives a more
consistent and user-friendly experience.

Change-Id: Iddac2cc46aa1eb1466ef9e956c01618ef4deac99

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 15:45:18.000000000', 'message': 'Replace default pip index check with upper constraints check

Now that the repo container is not reverse proxying pypi, the
default index check passes, but anything that tries to use it
prior to the repo build will fail because the repo server has
no wheels built yet.

Instead of checking whether the index is available we switch
to using the upper constraints file check, because that is
only present once the repo is actually built and there are
therefore wheels available on the pypiserver.

Change-Id: Ia9e2456ce17d23250add00462ea32d03788e0d16
'}]
commit_message:
Replace default pip index check with upper constraints check

Now that the repo container is not reverse proxying pypi, the
default index check passes, but anything that tries to use it
prior to the repo build will fail because the repo server has
no wheels built yet.

Instead of checking whether the index is available we switch
to using the upper constraints file check, because that is
only present once the repo is actually built and there are
therefore wheels available on the pypiserver.

Change-Id: Ia9e2456ce17d23250add00462ea32d03788e0d16

commit_message:
fix api-wg/sig project settings

The api-wg repository was renamed to api-sig in
7ccc97ca7eadfc6d6165500018c3c4bc84228ad2 but the project settings were
not updated, which means changes to zuul.d/projects.yaml are failing
validation.

Change-Id: Ibc337f67a638729f92662d81ac88e0ae9108e18a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
try to ensure 'templates' appears first

Use a CommentedMap which has an insert() method that lets us put the
set of templates at the start of the new output.

Change-Id: I8e5555f7be0ab35adf4a069f65d895340ce85031
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix CI: Remove tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario005-multinode-oooq

This job was removed by accident in https://review.openstack.org/581376
- and now zuul parser complains about the missing job. Remove the job instead
of restoring it, the job is experimental on an old branch.

Change-Id: Iecdeb5b63b2f27348162a57034a571391a8c8168

commit_message:
Add ability to specify minimum value when using capacity based QoS

When using capacity based QoS, it is possible that a user provisions
a volume that is very small but it unusable because of the very small
calculated IOPs.

This patch adds a few options to allow operators to allow for a minimum
value of IOPs, where the greater of the calculated value and minimum
is used as the QoS value.

Change-Id: I0fac45847f991d1f81ddcdd8674f8634f1cc4943

parameter_defaults:

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/ci/environments/multinode-3nodes.yaml looks to be the environment used here

Question: why does deployments.yaml look for the other node's  ansible_hostname? Unless somehow there are diff inventories of hostvars? The ordering is different, maybe?

commit_message:
Reparent 7-3 node jobs for zuul-v3

 - Add 7-3 nodeset
 - Reparent legacy jobs to use this nodeset
 - Remove scenario005 test - was never used
 - Ensure hosts are added in order to subnodes file

Change-Id: I78c74cc54fc0c0d5b39a00ee35c95bbcfda8055e

[{'created': '2018-08-04 13:10:22.000000000', 'message': 'Support Neutron L2GatewayConnection resource

The Neutron extension for layer2 gateway (networking-l2gw) provides a API to
manage L2GW components. The proposed change is to implement two new Heat
resources to allow management of the L2GW and L2GW-connection resources.
This change implements the 2nd of two resources,
OS::Neutron::L2GatewayConnection

Change-Id: Ic004170dd76349fc7f67cd8f28d58e6edf6b802b
Task: #23118
Story: #2002150
'}]
commit_message:
Support Neutron L2GatewayConnection resource

The Neutron extension for layer2 gateway (networking-l2gw) provides a API to
manage L2GW components. The proposed change is to implement two new Heat
resources to allow management of the L2GW and L2GW-connection resources.
This change implements the 2nd of two resources,
OS::Neutron::L2GatewayConnection

Change-Id: Ic004170dd76349fc7f67cd8f28d58e6edf6b802b
Task: #23118
Story: #2002150

subject: Revert shebang change for InstanceHA startup script
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 13:21:55.000000000', 'message': "Revert shebang change for InstanceHA startup script

In Id915ded03ae5a471ffa2dca13e2da90021279f63 the shebang for
check-run-nova-compute has been changed to use /usr/bin/env, which
broke exec'ing the script:

  + exec /var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute
  Running command: '/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute '
  /usr/bin/env: python -utt: No such file or directory

Revert the change for this script.

Change-Id: I96f82421638581122d687492f7420fd5724a7207
Closes-Bug: #1785245
"}]
commit_message:
Revert shebang change for InstanceHA startup script

In Id915ded03ae5a471ffa2dca13e2da90021279f63 the shebang for
check-run-nova-compute has been changed to use /usr/bin/env, which
broke exec'ing the script:

  + exec /var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute
  Running command: '/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute '
  /usr/bin/env: python -utt: No such file or directory

Revert the change for this script.

Change-Id: I96f82421638581122d687492f7420fd5724a7207
Closes-Bug: #1785245

set GLARE_API_URL parameter for horizon.

commit_message:
Add tempest test blacklist capability

While the whitelist may contain regex, sometimes using regex
is difficult and it is simpler just to blacklist the specific
test you're looking to block.

This patch adds the capability to specify a list of tests to
blacklist.

Change-Id: I16bd158ff8cd2e9b1ff42876dcf7796676f54b68
(cherry picked from commit 2cda0e178e6e6e172b10202880a302f2fad7f21f)

subject: Add verbose flag to container prep apt-key add
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 17:02:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add verbose flag to container prep apt-key add

Display which keys are being imported to the image cache in the log
file. The verbose output is not extremely long, but it does print
about 2 lines per key so the logs will show which apt-keys are
present in the cached image.

Change-Id: I6d8423d9d1c8f35fa64c8ffc985a8543e4d25954
'}]
commit_message:
Add verbose flag to container prep apt-key add

Display which keys are being imported to the image cache in the log
file. The verbose output is not extremely long, but it does print
about 2 lines per key so the logs will show which apt-keys are
present in the cached image.

Change-Id: I6d8423d9d1c8f35fa64c8ffc985a8543e4d25954

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 16:01:18.000000000', 'message': 'Use --version-sort instead of -n for role version bump

Using sort -n can mean that version x.9 is taken above version x.13 due
to how the sort will happen.

It is a better approach to adopt sort --version-sort

Change-Id: Ied5a2206f5d86838f2b0e083b11f9a063c5a1f63
'}]
commit_message:
Use --version-sort instead of -n for role version bump

Using sort -n can mean that version x.9 is taken above version x.13 due
to how the sort will happen.

It is a better approach to adopt sort --version-sort

Change-Id: Ied5a2206f5d86838f2b0e083b11f9a063c5a1f63

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Fix for multiple clones failure

Fix to ensure that the snapvx snapshots are cleaned
up periodically so that the max limit for snapvx snapshots
is not hit while creating multiple clones of a single volume

Change-Id: Idca6bb86fb0ee873093e4605b24fbc030b037854
Closes-bug: 1778947

commit_message:
Added test for Limit formatting routes when adding resources

Added test to allows identifiers with a '.' in delete metadata url.
A few tests were added to the extensions test to prove that .xml and
 .json are stripped.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571403/
Change-Id: I47b1a48fc07deea086470a71b93d88c8f9232932
Partial-Bug: #1774353

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: add host.created_by metadata key

This patch adds the "host.created_by" metadata key. The metadata value
indicates the name and version of the INFINIDAT tool which created the
relevant system object.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib5a78593a30a6b530dade412fab576981a7f2241

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 21:17:26.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in manila

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows manila to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: Ifffe3cad0f5cd52988ce253794efc5b03ea9840b

commit_message:
Fix mutable config in manila-scheduler

We had SIGHUP apply the "mutate" behavior to the
ProcessLauncher with [1], however, the scheduler
process does not use ProcessLauncher.

Oslo config made "debug" a mutable config option
in [3]

Closes-Bug: #1785129

[1] I6499ae6c98d9489a123bb20febd6c1ddb9e17b86
[3] I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90

Change-Id: Ifffe3cad0f5cd52988ce253794efc5b03ea9840b

commit_message:
check all_tenants value in share api

add manila.utils.is_all_tenants to check all_tenants value.
share_networks and security_service api will check all_tenants value
in the following patches.

Change-Id: I1aa9903276038dc839df45b852b329a75be5657f
Partial-Bug: #1777551
Co-Authored-By: Jiao Pengju <jiaopengju@cmss.chinamobile.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 10:09:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix default value for Gnocchi auth mode

The correct values or auth modes for Gnocchi are 'basic' and 'keystone'.
This patch fixes the 'simple' usage to 'basic'. Note that without this rename
the deployment works because when 'simple' is used the parameter is not used
in config file, so value 'basic' is used by python-collectd-gnocchi, because
it is implicit default.

Change-Id: I05632137ed12c59a41a5219189c431983935d461
"}]
commit_message:
Fix default value for Gnocchi auth mode

The correct values or auth modes for Gnocchi are 'basic' and 'keystone'.
This patch fixes the 'simple' usage to 'basic'. Note that without this rename
the deployment works because when 'simple' is used the parameter is not used
in config file, so value 'basic' is used by python-collectd-gnocchi, because
it is implicit default.

Change-Id: I05632137ed12c59a41a5219189c431983935d461

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 23:44:40.000000000', 'message': 'Robustness improvements for stack update of nova server.

Two main changes
1) If the server is missing (ie: deleted) it will be replaced by
stack-update.
2) If the server is in ERROR / FAILED state  it will attempt an update,
rather than defaulting to replace.

Note: a stack-update to change FLAVOR (ie: resize) will still be
rejected if the VM is in ERROR state

Change-Id: I61b6406461cc09ed5bdf147bb6caac33c94e2fe0
Story: 2002802
Task: 22699
'}]
commit_message:
Robustness improvements for stack update of nova server.

Two main changes
1) If the server is missing (ie: deleted) it will be replaced by
stack-update.
2) If the server is in ERROR / FAILED state  it will attempt an update,
rather than defaulting to replace.

Note: a stack-update to change FLAVOR (ie: resize) will still be
rejected if the VM is in ERROR state

Change-Id: I61b6406461cc09ed5bdf147bb6caac33c94e2fe0
Story: 2002802
Task: 22699

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 21:14:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

Change #550473 removed the quotes around ${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS}
when running the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook. This broke the
ability to specify multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS using the space
separated key=value syntax, as demonstrated in the AIO
Quickstart Guide.

This change fixes the brokenness of BOOTSTRAP_OPTS by pre-
fixing each BOOTSTRAP_OPTS item with a "-e", which will
accomodate specifying multiple vars files, as well as
specifying a mix of "key=value" and "@file.yml" items
in BOOTSTRAP_OPTS.

Change-Id: Ia32c646a180f3d3f868dc73eb38778853fbdf000
Fixes-Bug: 1784491
'}, {'created': '2018-08-02 19:01:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

commit_message:
Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

Change #550473 removed the quotes around ${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS}
when running the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook. This broke the
ability to specify multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS using the space
separated key=value syntax, as demonstrated in the AIO
Quickstart Guide.

This change fixes the brokenness of BOOTSTRAP_OPTS by pre-
fixing each BOOTSTRAP_OPTS item with a "-e", which will
accomodate specifying multiple vars files, as well as
specifying a mix of "key=value" and "@file.yml" items
in BOOTSTRAP_OPTS.

Change-Id: Ia32c646a180f3d3f868dc73eb38778853fbdf000
Depends-On: Ie3960e2e2ac9c0aff0bc36f46182be2fc0a038b3
Bug: 1784491

The utility playbook has a duplicated 'when', causing unexpected
results and a warning from Ansible. This change corrects the issue.

commit_message:
Initial support for adding cluster nodes to an existing cluster

We add a function which will detect if rerunning the manifest would
mean adding any cluster nodes. For those nodes we trigger the cluster
node addition via:
pcs cluster auth newnode
pcs cluster node add newnode
pcs cluster start newnode

Initial run with one node in cluster_members:
Online: [ foobar-0 ]

Full list of resources:

 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-1      (stonith:fence_amt):    Stopped
 Docker container: test_bundle [docker.io/sdelrio/docker-minimal-nginx]
   test_bundle-docker-0 (ocf::heartbeat:docker):        Started foobar-0
 ip-172.16.11.97        (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2):       Started foobar-0
 Clone Set: rabbitmq-clone [rabbitmq]
     Started: [ foobar-0 ]

Rerun with additional two additional nodes and by setting ::deep_compare
hiera keys to true so that resources get updated:
Online: [ foobar-0 foobar-1 foobar-2 ]

Full list of resources:

 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-1      (stonith:fence_amt):    Started foobar-1
 ip-172.16.11.97        (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2):       Started foobar-2
 Clone Set: rabbitmq-clone [rabbitmq]
     Started: [ foobar-0 foobar-1 foobar-2 ]
 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-2      (stonith:fence_amt):    Started foobar-0
 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-3      (stonith:fence_amt):    Started foobar-1
 Docker container set: test_bundle [docker.io/sdelrio/docker-minimal-nginx]
   test_bundle-docker-0 (ocf::heartbeat:docker):        Started foobar-0
   test_bundle-docker-1 (ocf::heartbeat:docker):        Started foobar-2
   test_bundle-docker-2 (ocf::heartbeat:docker):        Started foobar-1

Ran about 50 scaleup tests and this node addition code has worked all
the time. We have intentionally not yet added removal support as that
needs to have a use-case and a lot of testing.

For this scaleup to work properly we need a fix for the firewall
ordering issue, otherwise this could be racy when stonith is configured.
(i.e. we'll need I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065 if this
review ever gets backported).

Change-Id: Iac31035da98bd68a5481d97ee3765a99563db49f

subject: Support for OVS DB TCP socket communication.

Regards,
Pranab'}, {'account_id': 24654, 'date': '2018-08-01 10:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-01 10:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

we have code to introduce an abstract ovsdb api and support for the native python binding underview for some time. 
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/os-vif+branch:master+topic:bug/1666917

i would personally perfer to take that approach that said ill review this change properly now.

im not against support both the command line and python interfaces to the ovsdb but i would like to unify them behind that abstracted api and ensure the config options for speifying the db connection string are the same.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-01 11:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck os-vif-mlnx  failed to install mariadb...'}, {'account_id': 24654, 'date': '2018-08-01 11:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> we have code to introduce an abstract ovsdb api and support for the
 > native python binding underview for some time.
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/os-vif+branch:master+topic:bug/1666917
 > 
 > i would personally perfer to take that approach that said ill
 > review this change properly now.
 > 
 > im not against support both the command line and python interfaces
 > to the ovsdb but i would like to unify them behind that abstracted
 > api and ensure the config options for speifying the db connection
 > string are the same.

Hi Sean,
I understand your concern and am aware of those patches. AFAIK, 

 > we have code to introduce an abstract ovsdb api and support for the
 > native python binding underview for some time.
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/os-vif+branch:master+topic:bug/1666917
 > 
 > i would personally perfer to take that approach that said ill
 > review this change properly now.
 > 
 > im not against support both the command line and python interfaces
 > to the ovsdb but i would like to unify them behind that abstracted
 > api and ensure the config options for speifying the db connection
 > string are the same.

Thanks Sean. I understand your point. We are trying our best to add the ovsdb tcp connection feature by Rocky release. The patches that you mentioned are quite big and were contributed by Alonso. I communicated with him and unfortunately he mentioned that he is no longer involved in OpenStack project. Can we please go ahead this patch since it just adds a small config parameter?  Since adding an abstract and native python binding api would take time, I will be happy to work on it after Rocky release.'}, {'account_id': 24654, 'date': '2018-08-01 11:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> recheck os-vif-mlnx  failed to install mariadb...
Sean,
Is it possible that there are some issues with the Zuul test cases?
Weird, because yesterday I submitted the patches and it passed all the Zuul test cases. In the latest patchset, there were minor indentation related changes, nothing major that should result in Zuul test failure.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-01 12:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Thanks Sean. I understand your point. We are trying our best to add
 > the ovsdb tcp connection feature by Rocky release. The patches that
 > you mentioned are quite big and were contributed by Alonso. I
 > communicated with him and unfortunately he mentioned that he is no
 > longer involved in OpenStack project. Can we please go ahead this
 > patch since it just adds a small config parameter?  Since adding an
 > abstract and native python binding api would take time, I will be
 > happy to work on it after Rocky release.

We won't be able to do this for the Rocky release unfortunately because we're past the freeze date for dependent libraries.

It would take an act of Congress or similar I'm afraid to get Nova to bump its os-vif library version requirement even if we did make a new release of os-vif today.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't see any issue to have this merged prior the work on ovsdb"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:26:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I don't see any issue to have this merged prior the work on ovsdb

Neither do I. I was only mentioning the roadblock that we will run into trying to get Nova to change it's requirement version for os-vif for Rocky. :)"}, {'account_id': 24654, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:59:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > I don't see any issue to have this merged prior the work on ovsdb
 > 
 > Neither do I. I was only mentioning the roadblock that we will run
 > into trying to get Nova to change it's requirement version for
 > os-vif for Rocky. :)

Thanks Jay and Sahid.
Well, is it possible that I request for a FFE or back-port to the respective version?
-Pranab"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-01 16:34:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > > I don't see any issue to have this merged prior the work on
 > ovsdb
 > >
 > > Neither do I. I was only mentioning the roadblock that we will
 > run
 > > into trying to get Nova to change it's requirement version for
 > > os-vif for Rocky. :)
 > 
 > Thanks Jay and Sahid.
 > Well, is it possible that I request for a FFE or back-port to the
 > respective version?
 > -Pranab

Release freeze for non-client libraries (like this one) for Rocky was July 19 and an FFE at this point would be reserved only for critical bugs. Once the Stein cycle starts, a new os-vif release can be done but I don't expect this feature/new support meets with stable branch policy for a backport to Rocky."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-01 22:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

this is more invasive then i woulds like it to be however i cant see a cleaner way to do this without a larger refactor. i was trying to think if we could curry the argument using funtools.partial or something but nothing obvious was jumping out at me.

since this will be eaiser for a downstream disto to backport if they choose im ok with merging this first but looking at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476612/31 the reason it is failing ci is just a missing lower-constratint entry.

we usally freeze the non client libs untill at lest RC1 is out but i tend to agree this would be unlikely to qualify for a featre freeze exception or backport.

is this blocking a feature in a deployment tool or other project where tcp is required instead? in general tcp on anything other then localhost is discouraged for security reasons as the ovsdb does not have authentication by default.'}, {'account_id': 24654, 'date': '2018-08-03 09:42:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm cool merging it into master (we don't have a stable branch for os-vif, since it's a library and released using semver)."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-03 16:23:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah, my bad. I suppose we have stable branches for backporting fixes for the library version that was included at the time of the consuming project's release.

This certainly isn't a "fix" though, as we've mentioned a few times already.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-03 21:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

im not going to labour the point that this would not generally qualify for backport but since we have already cut the stable/rocky branch it is now safe to merge this into master as we can still chery-pick around it if we need too backport something else for rocky.

once the rocky release is finalised and we are ofically in the stien dev cycle we can look to do an early release of os-vif if that is useful to you however officially rocky upstream will not ship that version. if we do that it would be nice to renabled pyroute2 and  merge the other python ovs code too to make it a more substantial release then just tcp support. e.g. early in stein target swapping to python client instead of commanline client by default. 

anyway this looks fine to me so since jay is fine with it +2W'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 10:37:01.000000000', 'message': 'Support for OVS DB TCP socket communiation.

OVS DB server has the feature of listening over a TCP socket
for connections rather than just on the unix domain socket.[0]
If the OVS DB server is listening over a TCP socket, then the
ovs-vsctl commands should include the ovsdb_connection parameter:
eg:

Neutron supports running the ovs-vsctl commands with the ovsdb_connection
parameter. The ovsdb_connection parameter is configured in
openvswitch_agent.ini file. [1]
While adding a vif to the ovs bridge(br-int), Nova(os-vif) invokes the
ovs-vsctl command. Today, there is no support to pass the ovsdb_connection
parameter while invoking the ovs-vsctl command. The support should be added.
This would enhance the functionality of os-vif, since it would support a
scenario when OVS DB server is listening over a TCP socket connection and
will be on functional parity with Neutron.

[0] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovsdb-server.1.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: I3b0cadd48fd8823ab2dbec81b2c49dc4d33031ce
Closes-Bug: 1778724
'}, {'created': '2018-08-01 09:15:49.000000000', 'message': "Support for OVS DB TCP socket communication.

While adding a vif to the ovs bridge(br-int), Nova(os-vif) invokes the
ovs-vsctl command. This works fine when OVS DB server is listening for
connections over a UNIX file socket. OVS DB server can listen for connections
over a TCP socket too [0]. If the OVS DB server is listening over a TCP socket,
then the ovs-vsctl commands should include the optional argument
'--db=tcp:ip:port', else vif addition to OVS bridge would fail.
eg: ovs-vsctl --db=tcp:169.254.1.1:6640 add-port br-int eth0

This patch adds a new config parameter: 'ovsdb_connection'. By default,
if ovsdb_connection is set to 'None', communication with OVSDB server would
happen over the UNIX file socket. If it is set to tcp:IP:Port, ovs-vsctl commands
would use the '--db=tcp:IP:Port' parameter for communicating over a TCP socket.

Neutron already supports this feature. The ovsdb_connection parameter is
configured in openvswitch_agent.ini file. [1]
[0] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovsdb-server.1.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: I3b0cadd48fd8823ab2dbec81b2c49dc4d33031ce
Closes-Bug: 1778724

commit_message:
Support for OVS DB TCP socket communication.

While adding a vif to the ovs bridge(br-int), Nova(os-vif) invokes the
ovs-vsctl command. This works fine when OVS DB server is listening for
connections over a UNIX file socket. OVS DB server can listen for connections
over a TCP socket too [0]. If the OVS DB server is listening over a TCP socket,
then the ovs-vsctl commands should include the optional argument
'--db=tcp:ip:port', else vif addition to OVS bridge would fail.
eg: ovs-vsctl --db=tcp:169.254.1.1:6640 add-port br-int eth0

This patch adds a new config parameter: 'ovsdb_connection'. By default,
if ovsdb_connection is set to 'None', communication with OVSDB server would
happen over the UNIX file socket. If it is set to tcp:IP:Port, ovs-vsctl commands
would use the '--db=tcp:IP:Port' parameter for communicating over a TCP socket.

Neutron already supports this feature. The ovsdb_connection parameter is
configured in openvswitch_agent.ini file. [1]
[0] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovsdb-server.1.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: I3b0cadd48fd8823ab2dbec81b2c49dc4d33031ce
Closes-Bug: 1778724

commit_message:
Fix alembic migration template generator script

Change the alembic migration template generator script
to correctly have imports at the top, else next time
it's run the result will generate an E402 error.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I21d141696547a89f0a361b38d97688a03668c014

subject: Bump packethost back to 100 max-servers
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-08-03 21:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-03 22:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-08-03 22:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 21:53:02.000000000', 'message': "Bump packethost back to 100 max-servers

We've been running at 10 max servers for a day and a half and there are
no errors launching nodes according to grafana. Additionally the mirror
node (http://mirror.us-west-1.packethost.openstack.org) is still up and
running.

I think we are good to bump back up to 100 max servers given this under
the assumption that the disk size increases have made things happier.

Change-Id: I873c7067dc2f21e1f42b5b94fdec4e6df728e993
"}]
commit_message:
Bump packethost back to 100 max-servers

We've been running at 10 max servers for a day and a half and there are
no errors launching nodes according to grafana. Additionally the mirror
node (http://mirror.us-west-1.packethost.openstack.org) is still up and
running.

I think we are good to bump back up to 100 max servers given this under
the assumption that the disk size increases have made things happier.

Change-Id: I873c7067dc2f21e1f42b5b94fdec4e6df728e993

commit_message:
Add another up-call to the cells v2 caveats list

Due to change I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99 in Pike,
which ironically was meant to avoid up-calls (I think), it
introduced an up-call during reschedules for server create and
resize to set the instance.availability_zone based on the
alternate host selected during the reschedule.

This adds the up-call to our list of known issues in the cells
v2 docs so we can track the issue and make people aware of it.

Change-Id: Id819f91477613a013b89b1fb0b2def3b0fd4b08c
Related-Bug: #1781286

commit_message:
Change PXE logic to always link macs with UEFI

Our logic for elilo and grub excluded the MAC
address based links from being created, which are
handy for stand-alone use cases.

This patch changes the default to always write
MAC address based links, and allows the interface
to tolerate an exception being raised if the
``[dhcp]dhcp_provider`` is set to ``none``.

This effectively fixes the issue where users that
do not use neutron were unable to use UEFI.

Story: #2002887
Task: #22848
Change-Id: Ib8b9b2e3281184cd4e8d9a1a33a012f93edf237c

[{'created': '2018-08-02 13:48:07.000000000', 'message': "Use max version of an object

In the code for handling rolling upgrades (and pinned ironic versions),
we were assuming that for an object class (eg 'Node') that had more than
one version in a release, the first version was the latest one. This was
error-prone as humans don't always know/remember to put the latest version
as the first one in the list.

This patch removes the assumption and gets the maximum version in the list.

Change-Id: Ie0a789f8bfa6f286b58cc7211be85ee18b2800f5
"}]
commit_message:
Use max version of an object

In the code for handling rolling upgrades (and pinned ironic versions),
we were assuming that for an object class (eg 'Node') that had more than
one version in a release, the first version was the latest one. This was
error-prone as humans don't always know/remember to put the latest version
as the first one in the list.

This patch removes the assumption and gets the maximum version in the list.

Change-Id: Ie0a789f8bfa6f286b58cc7211be85ee18b2800f5

commit_message:
Add openstack client to Ansible venv

In order for the octavia role to upload the amphora image using
tags, we need to have access to the openstack CLI.

This will be necessary until the Ansible os_image module can
replace this shell task.

Change-Id: Ic75483dbab8a5dd43672b3234dbd19bad3d6e735

commit_message:
Normalise containers-lxc-* playbook structure

Some of the vars_files entries are duplicated and conflicting
with each other. In this patch we deduplicate those and
normalise the structure to make them easier to find/spot
next time.

Change-Id: Ia08388943b27f62ec4f95e6f583827b35a6311ae

[{'created': '2018-08-01 01:53:28.000000000', 'message': 'library policy create security groups up-front

minor improvement to the library policy to improve robustness.
Because actions by default execute in asynchronously, if we wait
to create the security group until the security group is needed,
the policy may attempt to attach to a security group before it is
created.

Change-Id: I0c2b1939c5b48d4576f821b482f120537c923808
'}, {'created': '2018-08-03 05:19:38.000000000', 'message': 'library policy create security groups up-front

minor improvement to the library policy to improve robustness.
Because actions by default execute in asynchronously, if we wait
to create the security group until the security group is needed,
the policy may attempt to attach to a security group before it is
created.

Change-Id: I0c2b1939c5b48d4576f821b482f120537c923808
'}]
commit_message:
library policy create security groups up-front

minor improvement to the library policy to improve robustness.
Because actions by default execute in asynchronously, if we wait
to create the security group until the security group is needed,
the policy may attempt to attach to a security group before it is
created.

Change-Id: I0c2b1939c5b48d4576f821b482f120537c923808

commit_message:
Fix typo xpvnc in get_remote_console schema

The type enumeration value xpvnc is a typo, which should
be xvpvnc indeed.
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-remote-console

[{'created': '2018-07-06 04:28:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix keystone-manage saml_idp_metadata under python3

metadata.to_string() was generating a bytes string, which python3
prepends with b'' when using the print function. Seems like

commit_message:
Fix keystone-manage saml_idp_metadata under python3

metadata.to_string() was generating a bytes string, which python3
prepends with b'' when using the print function. Seems like
removing the to_string() call and just calling print on the object
makes it work correctly under both python3 and python2.

Change-Id: I546ba0b15f6196be7bbb5940e9f00434d5e6b1ff
Closes-Bug: #1780377

commit_message:
sphinxext: Stop emitting lines multiple times

A typo resulted in us dumping the help text for opts as many times as
there were lines in the group help text. Resolve this.

Change-Id: I7a6506235834022fa76588e55ec60921b1ae673f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1782253

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 08:22:27.000000000', 'message': 'Execute security group setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we make the security group tasks execute using clouds.yaml
so that we do not need to expose the credentials in the task (it will leak
the credentials in vebose mode or on failure). We also set the tasks to
execute on octavia_service_setup_host so that we do not need as much
software installed on the target host.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: Idc8e5aa922541ab5f8464c83c006b1b7fc8308c5
'}, {'created': '2018-08-02 10:34:14.000000000', 'message': "Execute security group setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we make the tasks execute on octavia_service_setup_host so
that we do not need as much software installed on the target host. We
retain the use of the 'auth' arguments because the security group must
be created in the octavia service project, and the os_security_group
module does not support allowing an admin to create them in a different
project.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: Idc8e5aa922541ab5f8464c83c006b1b7fc8308c5
"}]
commit_message:
Execute security group setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we make the tasks execute on octavia_service_setup_host so
that we do not need as much software installed on the target host. We
retain the use of the 'auth' arguments because the security group must
be created in the octavia service project, and the os_security_group
module does not support allowing an admin to create them in a different
project.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: Idc8e5aa922541ab5f8464c83c006b1b7fc8308c5

commit_message:
Move role setup into service setup tasks

Instead of adding the same boilerplate as the service setup
in order to create the roles required, we simply move the
role creation into the service add tasks.

Change-Id: I27f26e79735dd1e60d41691deb70e11bbef315e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 09:06:48.000000000', 'message': "Convert tempest-scenario-all job to tempest-slow

As per discussion on ML[1], we do not have any job which runs only
slow tests.

This commit provide a separate job which run only slow tests which can
be API or scenario tests. Further this job can be used cross projects
like nova, cinder, neutron.

Why we need separate job for slow tests:
 - slow tests create gate issues on job timeout which we observed\
   during Rocky cycle[2]. Not to effect gate let's start them executing
   on separate job.
Why to convert the tempest-scenario-all job
 - tempest-scenario-all job was created to run the slow tests along with
   other scenario tests. But slow tests can be API tests[3] and mixing them
   with other scenario or API tests is not good idea.
 - All scenario tests excluding slow tests are run as part of tempest-full
   job so let's not run scenario tests twice on gate.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132527.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1783405
[3] https://ethercalc.openstack.org/dorupfz6s9qt

Change-Id: I5b1d3041c0140bea11705ad287f1472e74aacb5c
"}, {'created': '2018-08-03 07:05:51.000000000', 'message': "Convert tempest-scenario-all job to tempest-slow

slow tests.

 - tempest-scenario-all job was created to run the slow tests along with

 - All scenario tests excluding slow tests are run as part of tempest-full
   job so let's not run scenario tests twice on gate.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132527.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1783405
[3] https://ethercalc.openstack.org/dorupfz6s9qt

Change-Id: I5b1d3041c0140bea11705ad287f1472e74aacb5c
"}]
commit_message:
Convert tempest-scenario-all job to tempest-slow

As per discussion on ML[1], we do not have any job which runs only
slow tests.

This commit provide a separate job which run only slow tests which can
be API or scenario tests. Further this job can be used cross projects
like nova, cinder, neutron.

Why we need separate job for slow tests:
 - slow tests create gate issues on job timeout which we observed\
   during Rocky cycle[2]. Not to effect gate let's start them executing
   on separate job.
Why to convert the tempest-scenario-all job
 - tempest-scenario-all job was created to run the slow tests along with
   other scenario tests. But slow tests can be API tests[3] and mixing them
   with other scenario or API tests is not good idea.
 - All scenario tests excluding slow tests are run as part of tempest-full
   job so let's not run scenario tests twice on gate.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132527.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1783405
[3] https://ethercalc.openstack.org/dorupfz6s9qt

Change-Id: I5b1d3041c0140bea11705ad287f1472e74aacb5c

commit_message:
Masters are now given the role label for master

When clusters are created, there is no label assigned to masters. This is
common in most Kubernetes deployments, eg. kubeadm, kubespray, kops. Various
usage sometimes requires this label.

Change-Id: I9a1b81d5834feaab0c8981b25fd91a2218ed2e0b
Task: 22247
Story: 2002618

[{'created': '2018-08-03 12:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'Drop --tags=haproxy_server-config from run-upgrade.sh

448537c6591064faad653cbe438f6cafc7d7b296 attempted to fix this
by adding "=" to the --tags invocation, but the run-upgrade.sh
script still breaks at the exact same spot.

As suggested by evrardjp, just drop the --tags invocation altogether,
since haproxy-install.yml is rather quick to complete anyway.

Change-Id: I47102ff05e384302582ee5c4c308edbb1df81d27
Closes-Bug: #1778663
'}]
commit_message:
Drop --tags=haproxy_server-config from run-upgrade.sh

448537c6591064faad653cbe438f6cafc7d7b296 attempted to fix this
by adding "=" to the --tags invocation, but the run-upgrade.sh
script still breaks at the exact same spot.

As suggested by evrardjp, just drop the --tags invocation altogether,
since haproxy-install.yml is rather quick to complete anyway.

Change-Id: I47102ff05e384302582ee5c4c308edbb1df81d27
Closes-Bug: #1778663

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 12:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Allow flexible tag for Rabbit monitoring user

Without this patch, the monitoring user is forced to have the
tag "monitoring".

This is a problem, because some deployers would prefer having
another tag.

This patch solves the problem by allowing the tag to be a
variable, free form, that is defaulting to "monitoring".

Change-Id: I77a70842c034fa1f7fe78ff650f37358f0890bbe
'}]
commit_message:
Allow flexible tag for Rabbit monitoring user

Without this patch, the monitoring user is forced to have the
tag "monitoring".

This is a problem, because some deployers would prefer having
another tag.

This patch solves the problem by allowing the tag to be a
variable, free form, that is defaulting to "monitoring".

Change-Id: I77a70842c034fa1f7fe78ff650f37358f0890bbe

commit_message:
fix execution of horizon_translations_update.yml

Just realized, that 'static: no' ignores the include of the
translation update playbook. Without that and the explicit
tag brings the function back in service.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 07:56:56.000000000', 'message': 'Execute flavor setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also move the policy role setup into the same task
set given that this relates to that.

In this patch we make the flavor tasks execute using clouds.yaml so that
we do not need to expose the credentials in the task (it will leak the
credentials in vebose mode or on failure). We also set the tasks to execute
on octavia_service_setup_host so that we do not need as much software
installed on the target host.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: Ic2998b9a8a2bed80c9fe0fa9e033f243d3b0d5ae

commit_message:
Execute flavor setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we make the flavor tasks execute using clouds.yaml so that
we do not need to expose the credentials in the task (it will leak the
credentials in vebose mode or on failure). We also set the tasks to execute
on octavia_service_setup_host so that we do not need as much software
installed on the target host.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: Ic2998b9a8a2bed80c9fe0fa9e033f243d3b0d5ae

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also move the policy role setup into the same task
set given that this relates to that.

In this patch we remove the variable 'octavia_image_downloader' and replace
it with just using the 'octavia_service_setup_host' instead. We also need
to add the variable 'octavia_amp_image_path_owner' which is set to the user
running the playbook by default, so that the image can be downloaded to the
deployment host successfully.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

commit_message:
Execute image setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we remove the variable 'octavia_image_downloader' and replace
it with just using the 'octavia_service_setup_host' instead. We also need
to add the variable 'octavia_amp_image_path_owner' which is set to the user
running the playbook by default, so that the image can be downloaded to the
deployment host successfully.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: I438cdf695abe223a9fcf7ead796fe2eef41845b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 18:11:44.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I10f6d82cbdfe19fea577f276f95691115a07e01c

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts

All other tasks related to using the os_* modules and the openstack client
are also remodeled to re-use the same mechanism.

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

All other tasks related to using the os_* modules and the openstack client
are also remodeled to re-use the same mechanism.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/582494
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/582496
Change-Id: I10f6d82cbdfe19fea577f276f95691115a07e01c

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: I10f6d82cbdfe19fea577f276f95691115a07e01c

changing a git repository means a downtime of gerrit - is this really necessary?

this does not touch all needed files, grep for api-wg in the repo'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-06-14 18:04:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Understood about the downtime. I've added this to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/InfraTeamMeeting#Upcoming_Project_Renames as suggested by fungi.

commit_message:
Rename the API-WG to API-SIG

The group has changed its name and focus. This change reflects that.

Change-Id: Ic7fac6cd2b37fab7168b4e6416cf4ab135b737d4

commit_message:
Unretire the openstack-chef project

The maintainers for Chef OpenStack seek to use openstack-chef as the
entry point for the example repository for scripts and configs to reduce
friction with user onboarding. Restore it from the attic.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/585473
Change-Id: Iffa580af0a37ec08c735825332d02f358c2a958b
