Should this be interpreted as when (if) this is merged the mentioned bug is fully resolved? [1]

If that is the case (thinking with my ops hat on since I'm affected by this bug) I think operators would greatly appreciate if there was a way to enforce this fix without having to migrate/shelve etc for it to heal that is_bfv flag, maybe a nova-manage command which can be mentioned in an upgrade release note?

Thanks for all the work surrounding this change! I know it has been a lot of work.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1469179"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-24 12:29:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> If that is the case (thinking with my ops hat on since I'm affected by this bug) I think operators would greatly appreciate if there was a way to enforce this fix without having to migrate/shelve etc for it to heal that is_bfv flag, maybe a nova-manage command which can be mentioned in an upgrade release note?

Correct, at this time it would be set properly for new instances and healed for existing instances during a move.

I thought about a nova-manage online data migration for this, which we can still do, we just need to write it up."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-24 12:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Well, thinking more about that online data migration, I'm not sure what purpose it would serve since it would just set the flag, it wouldn't actually change the DISK_GB resource usage accounting on the host, and that's what you really need. So for existing volume-backed instances that are already reporting root_gb usage incorrectly, that won't change until they are moved, and when they get moved we'd heal anyway, so I'm not sure how much benefit an online data migration buys us."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-24 12:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Also, the change below this one in the series *does* fix the root_gb usage reporting in the compute service which is what the scheduler is going to rely on:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584204/

The RequestSpec.is_bfv changes are more for DISK_GB filtering in the scheduler *before* we pick a host.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 19:49:25.000000000', 'message': "Heal RequestSpec.is_bfv for legacy instances during moves

Change I9c2111f7377df65c1fc3c72323f85483b3295989 sets the
RequestSpec.is_bfv flag for newly created instances so
that scheduling (using placement) does not allocate DISK_GB
resources for the Flavor's root_gb when booting from volume.

RequestSpecs for old instances created before that change will
not have the is_bfv field set, so this change adds a check for
that in the various move operations (evacuate, unshelve, cold
migrate and live migrate) and sets the RequestSpec.is_bfv flag
accordingly.

The related functional test is updated for the legacy cold
migrate and heal scenario.

Change-Id: I8e529ad4d707b2ad012328993892db83ce464c4b
Closes-Bug: #1469179

commit_message:
Heal RequestSpec.is_bfv for legacy instances during moves

Change I9c2111f7377df65c1fc3c72323f85483b3295989 sets the
RequestSpec.is_bfv flag for newly created instances so
that scheduling (using placement) does not allocate DISK_GB
resources for the Flavor's root_gb when booting from volume.

RequestSpecs for old instances created before that change will
not have the is_bfv field set, so this change adds a check for
that in the various move operations (evacuate, unshelve, cold
migrate and live migrate) and sets the RequestSpec.is_bfv flag
accordingly.

The related functional test is updated for the legacy cold
migrate and heal scenario.

Change-Id: I8e529ad4d707b2ad012328993892db83ce464c4b
Closes-Bug: #1469179

commit_message:
Report 0 root_gb in resource tracker if instance is bfv.

hypervisor local_gb_used still reports usage even with volume-backed
instances after fix for bug 1469179.

This is because of some code in the resource tracker that is not
boot-from-volume aware when reporting disk usage, it just gets the
root_gb off the flavor:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/eb4f65a7951e921b1cd8d05713e144e72f2f254f/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L1455

This patch simply check if the instance is bfv before returning
the result. If it's a volume-backed instance and report 0 for root_gb if
that's the case.

Change-Id: I0839470c4bcfb16590a0d87b306d683b059bf8a9
Closes-bug: #1782393

commit_message:
WIP- DNM - Increase the flavor of BMC node for OVB

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1784822
details sporadic IPMI failures.
This review increases the size/resources of the bmc flavor
to test if the additional resources get the CI past
the IPMI failures.

Change-Id: I35b32eb011cb1fe9a882cd25bf3dee2840920d22

'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 10:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'Update queued-for-delete from the ComputeAPI during deletion.

This patch updates queued-for-delete column in the instance_mapping
table from the ComputeAPI during normal delete, force delete and
soft-delete (for both local delete and cell delete) operations.
Note that as the name of the column suggests, it is only "queued"
for deletion and does not guarantee successful deletion of the instance.
Hence the value could be stale which is fine, considering its use is
only during down cell (desperate) situation. This in no way hampers
normal delete operations in nova.

This column is also updated from the ComputeAPI during the
nova restore operation.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

commit_message:
Update queued-for-delete from the ComputeAPI during deletion/restoration

This patch updates queued-for-delete column in the instance_mapping
table from the ComputeAPI during normal delete, local delete (when
the compute service is down or instance is shelved offloaded) and
soft-delete operations. Note that as the name of the column suggests,
it is only "queued" for deletion and does not guarantee successful
deletion of the instance. Hence the value could be stale which is fine,
considering its use is only during down cell (desperate) situation.
This in no way hampers normal delete operations in nova.

This column is also updated from the ComputeAPI during the
nova restore operation.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I3de5c839d212cfab1c69e2c78617c1051b971c38

commit_message:
fix tox py27 job

- The current py27 tox env only runs the
  unit tests for core os-vif lib.
- This change removes --test-path="os_vif/tests"
  to renable the unit tests for all  in tree plugins.

Change-Id: Ife09b596d7bb009e623c8b9edbd424b8fc6f2556

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 04:08:02.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:UDP jinja template

This is the jinja template[1] for keepalived to enable lvs configuration.
And including some transfor function from obj to rendered configuration.

These files will split with the current Octavia repo, before other parts are
ok.

Patch List:

[1] Finish keepalived LVS jinja template for UDP support
[2] Extend the ability of amp agent for upload/refresh the keepalived
process
[3] Extend the db model and db table with necessary fields for met the new udp backend
[4] Add logic/workflow elements process in UDP cases
[5] Extend the existing API to access udp parameters in Listener API
[6] Extend the existing pool API to access the new option in
session_persistence fields

Change-Id: Ib23edb7190ffb777e4a95f45a253e8a632beb046

process
[3] Extend the db model and db table with necessary fields for met the new udp backend
[4] Add logic/workflow elements process in UDP cases
[5] Extend the existing API to access udp parameters in Listener API
[6] Extend the existing pool API to access the new option in
session_persistence fields

commit_message:
UDP jinja template

This is the jinja template[1] for keepalived to enable lvs configuration.
And including some transform function from obj to rendered configuration.

These files will split with the current Octavia repo, before other parts are
ok.

Patch List:

[1] Finish keepalived LVS jinja template for UDP support
[2] Extend the ability of amp agent for upload/refresh the keepalived
process
[3] Extend the db model and db table with necessary fields for met the new udp backend
[4] Add logic/workflow elements process in UDP cases
[5] Extend the existing API to access udp parameters in Listener API
[6] Extend the existing pool API to access the new option in
session_persistence fields

Story: 1657091
Task: 23208
Change-Id: Ib23edb7190ffb777e4a95f45a253e8a632beb046

commit_message:
Check if interface belongs to a Linux Bridge before removing

Checks if an interface belongs to a Linux Bridge before deleting
the interface and the bridge.

Change-Id: I03145681e0634ec52663a1ec4f54021e3325a6b1
Closes-Bug: #1736727
(cherry picked from commit 72b27d0e8664e3b4055dcf5d2fc191c94b696681)

[{'created': '2018-05-08 07:06:49.000000000', 'message': '[WIP/POC] Add queued_for_delete field to InstanceMapping object

This patch adds a new field queued_for_delete to InstanceMapping
object which would be used to represent the value in the queued_for_delete
column of the instance_mappings table for each record.

This will be set to True if an instance is either deleted or soft_deleted.

(INPROGRESS): Need to analyze if this is the right way of doing the data
migration for this field.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

commit_message:
Add queued_for_delete field to InstanceMapping object

This patch adds a new field queued_for_delete to InstanceMapping
object which would be used to represent the value in the queued_for_delete
column of the instance_mappings table for each record.

This will be set to True if an instance is either deleted or soft_deleted.

Will be adding a data migration tool for filling this field.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: Iebb6974efda6dd5b24bc9ad987b6400455c780b6

commit_message:
Deprecate xclarity hardware type

Lenovo Third Party CI is still being setup,
and while they are making forward progress,
we need to plan ahead for the Stein cycle.

As such, marking the xclarity hardware type
and related interfaces as deprecated.

Once Lenovo has their 3rd party CI operational,
this change can be reverted.

Change-Id: I3395063ce6a98e040518a133e7928f6c780f4829
Story: #2003097
Task: #23190
(cherry picked from commit 7cd960f8e1a10dead6837017e37d0cebd5c29247)

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

A new variable `cinder_environment_overrides` has been added to ensure
the correct PATH is set for cinder services.

This reverts commit b219b905367af4dba9936be9591065e76f86bea5.

Change-Id: I1cb10aa591a8262add47e2f5b61cfded9e28241d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Make kolla ansible user and group configurable

In some cases it is useful to use a user other than the default 'kolla'
to perform kolla ansible remote execution. Kolla is adding support for
this in the Rocky release, we should use it.

It is now possible to configure a different user via the
kolla_ansible_user and kolla_ansible_group variables.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/581330

Change-Id: I280fb8f70eacd31fff0ae5671ddd6608cd02ae6e
Story: 2002914
Task: 22892

[{'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-27 12:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-27 12:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-27 14:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1395523'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-07-27 15:11:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-30 02:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Some style issues, please see my inline comments.

And for the patch itself, I think the problem described in the bug report could not be solved by this(though this patch can help). The bug report referred to the creation of replication, and in Trove, interactions with swift occurs both on the API and guestagent side, and most of them happen inside the guestagent. For replication, this happend on the guestagent side, so even if we passed the check on the API side, we still could fail inside the guestagent. To solve this problem we may also have to refine the logic of the swift storage strategy and the guestagent, to take care about the service status of Swift, and when Swift is not working, detailed error should also reported to the API, and then the end user could find out what happened inside.'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-30 13:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-30 13:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(10 comments)

I've added swift availability check to guestagent as well as you suggested."}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-07-31 07:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-31 14:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-08-01 09:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-08-01 12:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks good. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-08-01 14:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24739, 'date': '2018-08-02 03:30:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This patch fix the bug from the API level. And according to bug description, it's what the reporter wants.
Agree with zhaochao, guestagent side maybe also occurs exception. To fix this may be need great changes, I think another patch will be better.
So with +1 now, and waiting for deal with zhanggang's comments.
Thanks for you working."}, {'account_id': 28713, 'date': '2018-08-02 06:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:25:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix replication failure when Swift isn't available

  * add Swift token verification in create instance method in Trove API
    when slave_id is given
  * catch ConnectionError exception in verify_swift_auth_token
  * add Swift token verification to guestagent before backup and restore
  * add new exception representing Swift connection error
  * set missing fault information when replication snapshot fails
  * mock verify auth token method in replication and restore unit tests

Closes-Bug: #1395523

Change-Id: I6a21ba2ba890a82875f9b6dae3c6b93bc9fdb4b0
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Krol <d.krol@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Remove `nova-compute:shared-db` relation

The relation between nova-compute and databases is not needed anymore.

See: https://review.openstack.org/499823/

commit_message:
Introduce nova:metadata and nova::wsgi::apache_metadata

Classes to configure and serve Nova Metadata API with apache
mod_wsgi in place of eventlet service.
Nova metadata parameters in nova::api get deprecated that we
can remove them later.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549510/ for more details.

Change-Id: Ic65736cb0e95c400a728cd699ecf06c6aecff832
Closes-Bug: 1781405

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 04:01:23.000000000', 'message': "Set mac-table-size for provider bridges defined in 'ovn_bridge_mappings'

The default mac table size may not be sufficient for the provider bridges.
If the mac table overflows, it has been observed that ovs-vswitchd clocks
100% CPU. So this patch configures the mac table size of the provider bridges.
It defaults to 50000 if the value is not specified.

This patch also clears the ovn-bridge-mappings property from the OpenvSwitch's
default tables row's external_ids column if 'bridge_interface_mappings' param
is not set.

Change-Id: I8f392c7807c4c6a152dfa4b77c7f4350b44324c0
Closes-bug: #1779706
Closes-bug: #1774847
(cherry picked from commit 88aa5c9184f8f448aed499413cda51188d66c7a6)
"}]
commit_message:
Set mac-table-size for provider bridges defined in 'ovn_bridge_mappings'

The default mac table size may not be sufficient for the provider bridges.
If the mac table overflows, it has been observed that ovs-vswitchd clocks
100% CPU. So this patch configures the mac table size of the provider bridges.
It defaults to 50000 if the value is not specified.

This patch also clears the ovn-bridge-mappings property from the OpenvSwitch's
default tables row's external_ids column if 'bridge_interface_mappings' param
is not set.

Change-Id: I8f392c7807c4c6a152dfa4b77c7f4350b44324c0
Closes-bug: #1779706
Closes-bug: #1774847
(cherry picked from commit 88aa5c9184f8f448aed499413cda51188d66c7a6)

commit_message:
Avoid namespace security group overwrite

Ensure default security group value does not get overwritten in
subsequent calls to get_security_groups

Closes-Bug: 1785035
Change-Id: I9a79601beae7d58027418e0a9e3c4768606eb15f

[{'created': '2018-08-02 13:47:23.000000000', 'message': "Check if it's leader before calling leader_set()

There may be situations where leader-elected hook is executed without
being the leader and making leader_set() calls fail, this patch verifies
if it's the leader before attempting to use leader_set()

Change-Id: Ia435069f5df80bfdf0236d14664317990bd06407
Closes-Bug: 1784584
(cherry picked from commit 1219f7b2a213af5d5697a1c4cb48486e9c08c81e)
"}]
commit_message:
Check if it's leader before calling leader_set()

There may be situations where leader-elected hook is executed without
being the leader and making leader_set() calls fail, this patch verifies
if it's the leader before attempting to use leader_set()

Change-Id: Ia435069f5df80bfdf0236d14664317990bd06407
Closes-Bug: 1784584
(cherry picked from commit 1219f7b2a213af5d5697a1c4cb48486e9c08c81e)

commit_message:
Cleanup specs for Rocky

We've released 11.0 and about to release 11.1,
and a number of new features landed in that which
means we can close out the specs in our spec
documentation.

As for rescue, we finally managed to get the rescue
patch landed in nova, and as such moved to the 10.1
folder.

Change-Id: I450784e7281e0d251c5f230b2d14be244e6c083f

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

neutron has bumped the min requirement for neutron-lib to 1.18.0 [1]
and requested that other networking-* projects that depend on master
do the same [2]. This makes that change.

[1] 02e9f270e913f26a16f40f161c333e54f2dbdef7
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132412.html

Change-Id: I2e38a02c5d34b2b62241e8a3cb8aafffc3c48d6b

commit_message:
doc: fix resize user guide link

The admin config resize doc was linking to a now non-existent
user guide doc which was deleted in pike. This change imports
the resize user guide from the openstack-manuals stable/ocata
branch, fixes the link, and updates the resize user doc to
(1) link to our internal shutdown_timeout config option reference
and (2) link to the image properties doc in glance for the
os_shutdown_timeout image property.

Change-Id: I9988abfd344d1d3b0b6eaf32b036369b51853965
Closes-Bug: #1784715

commit_message:
Stop setting glance_api_version in cinder.conf in nova-live-migration

The glance_api_version config option was removed from cinder
in Queens [1] so we can stop setting it during the
nova-live-migration CI job.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/queens.html

Change-Id: Ifbadce909393268b340b7a08c78a6faa2d7888b2

commit_message:
Wait for vif plugging during live migration job

The nova-live-migration CI job uses OVS which sends
vif plugged events to the source host during live
migration when the destination host plugs vifs
during pre_live_migration. We can set the
live_migration_wait_for_vif_plug option to True
so that the source host waits for the vif to be
plugged and get the event from neutron before
starting the actual guest transfer in the hypervisor.

This is really just about coverage of this code
in a live environment so we don't regress it.

Change-Id: I3d7770589a1526e851d5764214c26ec1a9a8fd43

[{'account_id': 19844, 'date': '2018-06-20 20:45:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19844, 'date': '2018-06-20 20:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-06-20 20:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi Kien, thanks for helping with that. can you also remove the reporting of allocated_capacity_gb? Per Cinder past discussions and definitions[1][2], that value should be calculated by Cinder volume manager and not be reported by the driver.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/85ca014ac8c3cce48abc025318b522ab247ee560/doc/source/contributor/thin_provisioning.rst
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/queens/provisioning-improvements.html'}, {'account_id': 19844, 'date': '2018-06-20 20:59:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix remotefs driver report wrong value

allocated_capacity_gb should not be reported by drivers and let the
manager handle this.
provisioned_capacity_gb is reporting allocated physical space. Return
provisioned.

Change-Id: I7e1b8d5b399a8dd15bb0dee477090a45c2faa6fa
Closes-Bug: #1746233
Signed-off-by: Kien Ha <kienha9922@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Helm-Toolkit: Update tls secret manifest for non public endpoints

This PS updates the tls secret manifest to allow non-public endpoints
to be specified.

Change-Id: I47606e5c8db87fac07febb114334ded710f56ed5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Keystone: enable external access to admin endpoint

This PS moves to use port 80 by default for the keystone
asdmin endpoint, and adjusts paths accordingly.

Change-Id: Iccae704dadc17eba269e857301654782f64763c9
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 09:24:47.000000000', 'message': '[QoS] Clear rate limits when default null values are used

In that case before, tc was called with zero rate and burst values.
Newer iproute versions (>= 4.9) do not allow that anymore, so we send a
clear command instead

This also fixes QoS L3 agent extension functional tests run with such an
iproute version (CentOS 7.5, Ubuntu 18.04)

Change-Id: Idf16e2460bd434f5eab79745558c55c6579e81e8
Closes-Bug: #1782141
'}]
commit_message:
[QoS] Clear rate limits when default null values are used

In that case before, tc was called with zero rate and burst values.
Newer iproute versions (>= 4.9) do not allow that anymore, so we send a
clear command instead

This also fixes QoS L3 agent extension functional tests run with such an
iproute version (CentOS 7.5, Ubuntu 18.04)

Change-Id: Idf16e2460bd434f5eab79745558c55c6579e81e8
Closes-Bug: #1782141

subject: Add ownership information field
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24828, 'name': 'Kaifeng Wang', 'email': 'kaifeng.w@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangkf'}, {'_account_id': 26340, 'name': 'Ilya Etingof', 'email': 'etingof@gmail.com', 'username': 'etingof'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-10 17:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-10 17:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-11 09:32:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good for me, this is quite straightforward.

Apparently 64 chars can't hold much, seems like it will be used as saving some SN like thing. What I'm thinking is if we support putting some hardware information there, model or some unique id on board for example.

Considering this, it might help:

Some type of model has defect, this detail helps us applying workarounds if it is possible. Switching from vendor oob to standard ipmi, by batch updating nodes configuration, passing to custom ramdisk to do something differently, just some thoughts come out of mind."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the review, I was conceptually thinking that it could be "customer-x" or "remote-ironic-z.lab.org" in the case of federating the deployment.

Or it could just just be something that correlates back to a customer accounting system. I can't imagine really needing more than 64 characters for that.... We can make it longer, I was just thinking of minimizing database impact.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-12 01:18:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, we have a unique serial number for each asset, details can be queried from the asset management system, it's the latter case.

I am good with the length, just thinking some possibility to put more use case, anyway it might be another story."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-12 13:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 560089 to story/2001814'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-04-12 13:36:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Without fully reading the spec - it seems like keystone project or user ID would also be a good fit here (not sure if we want to use it for actual links to those later or not). We should make this field at least as long as keystone's fields. I'm not sure how long those are, as non-UUIDs are acceptable by keystone. I feel like it's 255, but not sure."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:28:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Without fully reading the spec - it seems like keystone project or
 > user ID would also be a good fit here (not sure if we want to use
 > it for actual links to those later or not). We should make this
 > field at least as long as keystone's fields. I'm not sure how long
 > those are, as non-UUIDs are acceptable by keystone. I feel like
 > it's 255, but not sure.

From what TheJulia said on the call it seems like a different type of ownership from a keystone user, i.e. its the physical owner for tax purposes rather than the assigned "owner"/user, perhaps we need both? Although for physical owner information isn't that what the "extra" field is for, i.e operator metadata?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-03 11:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-25 09:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 17:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

LGTM modulo a few minor technical things (can be solved on the code patch).'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-07-23 13:46:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Thanks Julia. I'm fine with this, although I have two thoughts:
1. whoever asked for this feature; does this satisfy their need?
2. vdrok has this spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/415512/, which also proposes a node.owner field. If that field isn't the same 'owner' info, we might want to think a bit about the naming of this field."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-07-24 02:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-24 12:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-08-02 12:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-08-02 13:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-08-02 13:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks Julia! Please do a follow up to address the comments.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-02 18:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}]

commit_message:
Fix missing print format error

Missing print format will cause 'ValueError: unsupported
format character' error, this is to fix it.

commit_message:
Namespace isolation tempest coverage

It creates a new test to ensure proper isolation between namespaces.
It creates different pods in different namespaces and check that
traffic is block between them, unless it is the default namespace,
which can reach all the namespaces and be reached by all of them.

Depends-On: Ibf63841b2a6b0c339c4c76980f1489e26af016d7
Implements: blueprint openshift-project-isolation-support

Change-Id: Ie72c93564f38bc51a3abd009085beda92430daea

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 17:51:20.000000000', 'message': "Make installation of epel-release optional

The epel-release package provides a yum repository configuration for
EPEL, and points to the upsteam EPEL mirrors. In some cases this is
undesirable, such as when a local EPEL mirror is available, or access to
the public repositories is not possible.

This change makes it possible to skip installation of epel-release, by
setting 'yum_install_epel' to 'false'.

Change-Id: Ib685b0c3e21df01c4dd177771f019fae4bb90e66
Story: 2003277
Task: 24218

commit_message:
Make installation of epel-release optional

The epel-release package provides a yum repository configuration for
EPEL, and points to the upstream EPEL mirrors. In some cases this is
undesirable, such as when a local EPEL mirror is available, or access to
the public repositories is not possible.

This change makes it possible to skip installation of epel-release, by
setting 'yum_install_epel' to 'false'.

Change-Id: Ib685b0c3e21df01c4dd177771f019fae4bb90e66
Story: 2003277
Task: 24218

commit_message:
Add multi-store support

Made provision for multi-store support. Added new config option
'enabled_backends' which will be a comma separated Key:Value pair
of store identifier and store type.

DocImpact
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/573648
Implements: blueprint multi-store

Change-Id: I9cfa066bdce51619a78ce86a8b1f1f8d05e5bfb6

messages:
[{'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-05-17 17:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-05-18 08:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

please see https://review.openstack.org/569196'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-05-18 16:58:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks @Withold, Our QA found an issue in Horizon of our cloud which is pike based. He created a regular user, this user can see the monitoring panel but can not see the data. Whenever try to access data it throws exception. The monitoring panel should not be visible to a regular user. I applied the master's policy to the pike based cloud, it seems to work.  I didn't realize some compatibility issues in monasca-api. Please advise how to proceed to fix pike and queens problem. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-05-23 18:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Witold, instead of using the policy change in master, maybe remove owner since it is not really used and which causes anyone can see the panel but can not see the data and not be able to use the monitoring capabilities. Please advise. Thanks.
monitoring:monitoring": "rule:admin_or_owner",'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-07-05 07:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could we add custom `monintoring_policy.json` to https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/Cloud:OpenStack:Upstream:Pike/openstack-horizon-plugin-monasca-ui ?'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-08-02 17:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Witold, yeah, created a custom patch for that. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583412/'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-08-02 17:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Pike might be too old to patch.'}]

commit_message:
correct typo

The fleet env.d config had a typo in it which would causing a failure
within OSA dynamic inventory. This corrects the issue.

Change-Id: I36016f4733a8800adbcce71abbb290ab4a24798b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Stop logging sensitive data in cell_v2 provider

Parses the nova cell_v2 transport_uri/database_connection and rebuilds with
the password hidden in is_to_s and should_to_s (used for logging the changes).

Change-Id: I6523ed70536e438d38d9165e31d5d4d214bbc62c

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't see how your change makes it easier for admins to understand the problem, on the other hand, maybe you should add some reno or info or just add something in the description of this config option as a known issue before we could come up with some better way to fix this."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/576693/1/ : FAILURE in 4h 47m 36s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The correct way to fix force_hosts with placement would be to add a corresponding uuid or in_tree filter to GET /allocation_candidates like we have in GET /resource_providers, and then we can have a pre-request placement filter to add that in the force_hosts situation. That requires a spec and API change to placement first.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We probably need to mention the force_hosts issue in the "max_placement_results" config option help text itself, and also in the docs on using force hosts:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/availability-zones.html'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Another alternative until we have a pre-request placement filter is to *not* send the limit to GET /allocation_candidates if the request includes force_hosts. The performance on that won't be great, but it's the same as a workaround of setting a very high max_placement_results limit for *all* requests, and could be mitigated in the future with a pre-request placement filter when GET /allocation_candidates gets an in_tree query parameter like GET /resource_providers."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-06-26 08:17:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yup, given force_hosts is only used by admins, they know the number of compute nodes they have. If so, they can either modify the limit value for more than 1000, or just accept to have a less performant schedule time (if we don't use limit with force_hosts)"}, {'account_id': 21914, 'date': '2018-06-26 13:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21914, 'date': '2018-06-26 13:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:25:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

zvm:recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-27 06:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-20756 : SUCCESS in 56m 43s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-27 08:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/576693/4/ : FAILURE in 3h 07m 00s'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-06-27 08:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

seems ok, could it be better if we have a way to filter rps by uuid? which might solve this problem and also be efficient. it is like make the previous az filter up to the placement.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-27 12:51:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I think this is conceptually the right quick and backportable fix, but I think the implementation could do with some tweaking.

'force' is not a real concept in the RequestGroup, but limit makes sense to be there (since it is used to generate the query parameters). What I would suggest you do is add a limit=True kwarg (instead of force) to the __init__ of RequestGroup (or have it as an attribute that defaults to True) and set it to False when force_hosts or force_nodes is true.

This way the forcing concepts don't bleed into the request group, where they don't really make any sense."}, {'account_id': 21914, 'date': '2018-06-28 02:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-28 04:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Disable limits if force_hosts or force_nodes is set

Setting max_placement_results will make force_host invaild sometimes,
especially in large-scale enviroment.
Disable limit param in GET /allocation_candidates if force_hosts
or force_nodes is set.

Change-Id: Iff1b49fe7e6347e3c2bb5992494b2450809719a2
Closes-Bug: #1777591

commit_message:
Grafana: Fix Ceph pool usage dashboard panel

This fixes the ceph pool usage panel for displaying the percentage
utilization. As it's a percentage unit, multiplying the expression
by 100 resulted in erroneous values as the true percentage was
being multipled by 100 again

Change-Id: Ie4e85f5547df4b1749280acd7ff858005b91eee9

[{'created': '2018-08-02 16:54:11.000000000', 'message': 'Start running jobs on packethost again

Last time we learned things about networking and MTUs, this time we
learned things about disk and not running out of it. We now have many
more terabytes of disk space on our hypervisors so that we crash VMs
(like our mirror) when they run out of disk.

Change-Id: I2b1363c5a1e049082892d2f5f775a8309a19a04a
'}]
commit_message:
Start running jobs on packethost again

Last time we learned things about networking and MTUs, this time we
learned things about disk and not running out of it. We now have many
more terabytes of disk space on our hypervisors so that we crash VMs
(like our mirror) when they run out of disk.

Change-Id: I2b1363c5a1e049082892d2f5f775a8309a19a04a

commit_message:
undercloud: configure insecure registry with undercloud.conf

... and not with the workaround in overcloud-prep-containers.sh.
We have the interface to do it via undercloud.conf, let's use it.

Note: it works fine with both tripleoclient for containerized undercloud
and instack-undercloud for non-containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I27d0350d71cd3319782337936992787329978ee4

subject: Add support for Mellanox switches running MLNX-OS
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 15:25:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for Mellanox switches running MLNX-OS

Mellanox switches running MLNX-OS cannot be managed using the Ansible onyx*
modules, as the OS is too old. This change uses the stackhpc.mellanox-switch
Ansible role to configure these devices using the Ansible expect module.

Change-Id: I86f654c95be05e3a82d6015e4c89093127553408
Story: 2002687
Task: 22512
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for Mellanox switches running MLNX-OS

Mellanox switches running MLNX-OS cannot be managed using the Ansible onyx*
modules, as the OS is too old. This change uses the stackhpc.mellanox-switch
Ansible role to configure these devices using the Ansible expect module.

Change-Id: I86f654c95be05e3a82d6015e4c89093127553408
Story: 2002687
Task: 22512

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 14:31:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix handling of switch_type variable in Ansible 2.5

In Ansible, playbook group variables take precedence over inventory
group variables. Typically in a kayobe-config we might specify the
switch_type variable for a group containing switches using inventory
group_vars. This seemed to work in Ansible 2.3, but since Ansible 2.4
the default value of None in kayobe's playbook group_vars takes
precedence. This behaviour is as documented, not sure why it worked
previously.

This change removes the default value of None set in the playbook
group_vars.

Change-Id: I042ad8d115cdc0dd57a116e1be9d397ef4d216ae
Story: 2002903
Task: 22870
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of switch_type variable in Ansible 2.5

In Ansible, playbook group variables take precedence over inventory
group variables. Typically in a kayobe-config we might specify the
switch_type variable for a group containing switches using inventory
group_vars. This seemed to work in Ansible 2.3, but since Ansible 2.4
the default value of None in kayobe's playbook group_vars takes
precedence. This behaviour is as documented, not sure why it worked
previously.

This change removes the default value of None set in the playbook
group_vars.

Change-Id: I042ad8d115cdc0dd57a116e1be9d397ef4d216ae
Story: 2002903
Task: 22870

[{'created': '2018-08-02 16:32:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add endpoint scheme lookup function

This patch set adds gotpl function to lookup the scheme for an endpoint,
similar to the parallel functions to look up the port and host.  The
need for this function is to account for how some httpProbes in the
readiness checks hard code in the scheme of "HTTP" (see [0]).  This
will cause problem should the deployer switches this to HTTPS.
This adds in the flexibility to correctly switch to the correct
protocol.

commit_message:
Add endpoint scheme lookup function

This patch set adds gotpl function to lookup the scheme for an endpoint,
similar to the parallel functions to look up the port and host.  The
need for this function is to account for how some httpProbes in the
readiness checks hard code in the scheme of "HTTP" (see [0]).  This
will cause problem should the deployer switches this to HTTPS.
This adds in the flexibility to correctly switch to the correct
protocol.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/blob/bae870c4e060fd765debf4cd14528d50fa931a85/kube-dns/templates/deployment-kube-dns.yaml#L89

Change-Id: Ib681aa8ce1a351102f0bdebdda40d5c3ca69206e
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

The variable `cinder_iscsi_helper` is used not only in the `cinder` role,

commit_message:
Extract cinder_iscsi_helper default from role

The variable `cinder_iscsi_helper` is used not only in the `cinder` role,
but also in the `iscsi` role. It needs to have a default accessible for
both roles.

Change-Id: I33d7f2c7b5597a541a0d104c76520ac4a1cd5026
Closes-Bug: #1785066

'}, {'created': '2018-05-08 16:01:39.000000000', 'message': 'Annotate flows and handle PortBindingDeletionFailed in ComputeManager

This change adds comments to the live migration methods about
some of the network API calls since it can get very confusing
trying to trace what is happening with networking during
live migration since the network API has several similar
sounding methods.

This also handles PortBindingDeletionFailed which can be raised
from the neutronv2 API implementation of setup_networks_on_host
when teardown=True. There are three cases that can hit this:

1. post live migration at the destination cleaning up the source
   host port bindings
2. rollback live migration at the source cleaning up the
   destination host port bindings
3. rollback live migration at the destination cleaning up the
   destination host port bindings

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558990/

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <sean.k.mooney@intel.com>

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I1ba00850bdd7c015c5f462f1d75a5b833a5e9af9

commit_message:
Annotate flows and handle PortBindingDeletionFailed in ComputeManager

This change adds comments to the live migration methods about
some of the network API calls since it can get very confusing
trying to trace what is happening with networking during
live migration since the network API has several similar
sounding methods.

This also handles PortBindingDeletionFailed which can be raised
from the neutronv2 API implementation of setup_networks_on_host
when teardown=True. There are three cases that can hit this:

1. post live migration at the destination cleaning up the source
   host port bindings
2. rollback live migration at the source cleaning up the
   destination host port bindings
3. rollback live migration at the destination cleaning up the
   destination host port bindings

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558990/

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <sean.k.mooney@intel.com>

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I1ba00850bdd7c015c5f462f1d75a5b833a5e9af9

commit_message:
Assure that PeriodicTask passes context as args

Enginefacade expects that the first argument of functions are either
self, cls or the context. At the same time, PeriodicTask was sending
context as a kwargs called context. Because the introspection that
enginefacade does only happens on args this was causing an error with
PeriodicTask.

This patch modifies the behavior of PeriodicTask so it only sends the
context as enginefacade expects it -an args.

Change-Id: I7edb4c3284a358fba80e4fe68a0cd0f08f809b1a
Closes-Bug: #1781787

there are patches being issued to gradually move them. The last patch
that dealt with retry decorators [1] was incomplete, but somehow the
gate succeeded and it still succeeds, although it fails locally.

This patch fixes this problem by consuming the retry decorator from

commit_message:
Consume DB retry decorator from neutron-lib

In a process of moving common things out of neutron and into neutron-lib
there are patches being issued to gradually move them. The last patch
that dealt with retry decorators [1] was incomplete, but somehow the
gate succeeded and it still succeeds, although it fails locally.

This patch fixes this problem by consuming the retry decorator from
neutron-lib as it was originally intended. In addition, it bumps the
requirements to the version required for this to work.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/570028

Change-Id: I73f39190cac5f17412ff272a1bdfecfa7d7c3f68

[{'created': '2018-03-09 21:20:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: libvirt: use dest host vif migrate details for live migration

This takes the vif details from the destination host and uses them
to update the guest xml on the source host prior to starting the
live migration.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <sean.k.mooney@intel.com>

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I91627412744dad65122240f0aeb7a57ee85ba313

commit_message:
libvirt: use dest host vif migrate details for live migration

This takes the vif details from the destination host and uses them
to overwrite the guest xml on the source host prior to starting the
live migration. This allows live migrating between different vif
types on different compute hosts.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <sean.k.mooney@intel.com>

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I91627412744dad65122240f0aeb7a57ee85ba313

commit_message:
libvirt: use dest host port bindings during pre_live_migration

This uses the destination host port binding information to plug
vifs on the destination host during pre_live_migration.

This gets "turned on" later in the series when conductor sets the
migrate_data.vifs field.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

commit_message:
libvirt: factor out pre_live_migration plug_vifs call

The pre_live_migration() method is already large so this
factors out the plug_vifs() call into a separate method
since we're going to build on it in an upcoming patch.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: Iad4edecee9866d4eadd9da2d81b6fba214578c91

commit_message:
Nova: move rootwrap config to be values.yaml driven

This PS updates the nova rootwrap config to be values.yaml driven,
inline with neutron and cinder.

Change-Id: I3df7e7de583a75234a6bc4a71a32bd0a8d369332
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Remove legacy-muranoclient-dsvm-functional-mysql-backend for muranoclient

We move legacy-muranoclient-dsvm-functional-mysql-backend job to muranoclient,
so remove this job from project-config.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586746/
Change-Id: Ib4bfe118e8f39bc9888fbdbff4cbece00106a38d

commit_message:
docs: Write high availability devref

Adds contributor/developer reference for High Availability in Cinder.

Not only related to Active-Active, but also to Active-Passive and
concurrency in general.

Change-Id: Idfb04652f148e1f820d76d62395fe7cfcb445057

commit_message:
NEC driver: Return non-random iscsi portal in initialize

Returns same set of portals in initialize, this will
suits for both single-path and multipath situations.

Change-Id: Ifd241a9fa34957a3bfc8b3a768d18a781519eefe
Closes-Bug: #1742587

commit_message:
Add VIFMigrateData.get_dest_vif

This adds a simple helper function to VIFMigrateData to
get a destination VIF object based on the set source_vif
but updated with destination port binding details. This
will be used by the libvirt driver in later patches in
the series.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I4c5b1fee4a4f6b6ab7b0b1bb2c1049e23a981b48

commit_message:
Add VIFMigrateData object for live migration

- This change adds a new VIFMigrateData object.
- This change adds a new vifs field to the
  base LiveMigrateData object.

Later patches will populate this information during
live migration where nova uses the neutron port
binding extended API to bind the port on the destination
host, and store the destination host binding details
in this object to be leveraged on the source host for
things like defining vif details in the guest before
starting the live migration in the hypervisor.

Note that vif_details and profile must be stored as
serialized dicts similar to
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo.connection_info_json.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I174ae21f143016bb23b8043fa22465dac6c71314

Remove various windmill jobs from projects.yaml

All of these projects are in the middle of being converted to in-tree
jobs. It is safe for us to remove these jobs as we plan to land
in-tree changes right away.

Change-Id: Ia64eff3dcca47d023d950faeca82de8d660ab71b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Offered for your consideration.

We can explore doing a new microversion if that's what people desire, but here's the easy version in case people are okay with that."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-19 11:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/583907/2/ : SUCCESS in 4h 02m 07s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This should definitely have a microversion. But I don't care. The only way somebody is going to run afoul of the "new" 400 is if they have a bad field. If they have a bad field it is more than likely because they misspelled something. If they misspelled something, they're not getting the behavior they expected because that field is being ignored instead of processed as they would have expected if they had spelled it right. So it's likely hiding a latent bug for them. This will expose that bug. They'll thank us for it.'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-07-20 03:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-22 05:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-23 14:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Replying my comment from the bug:

"""


Being an admin-only API also comes into play at some level. It's one thing for applications and users of the cloud to break on interop stuff like this, but it's another for admin-only / service level type APIs which we don't expect regular users to be hitting directly. It's a fine line but that's one way to justify not doing a microversion.

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/microversions.html#when-a-microversion-is-not-needed
"""'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-23 14:13:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Easy peasy. I've always wondered why additionalProperties=false isn't the default..."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 09:46:04.000000000', 'message': '[placement] disallow additional fiels in allocations

Back in microversion 1.12, when the allocations structure was extended
to allow project_id and user_id on PUT /allocations/{uuid},
"additionalProperties" was not set in the JSON schema, so it has been
possible since then to include unused fields in the input. The schema
was then reused in the creation of subsequent schema for new
microversions and for new URIs, such as POST /allocations and the
forthcoming /reshaper.

This change fixes it by fixing the old microversion. This is the "just
fix it" option from the discussion on the associated bug. The other
option is to create a new microversion that corrects the behavior. This
is more complex than it might initially sound because of the way in
which the original schema is used to compose new ones.

Change-Id: Ied464744803864e61a45e03c559760a8a2e2581f
Closes-Bug: #1782340
'}, {'created': '2018-07-19 09:46:30.000000000', 'message': '[placement] disallow additional fields in allocations

to allow project_id and user_id on PUT /allocations/{uuid},
"additionalProperties" was not set in the JSON schema, so it has been
possible since then to include unused fields in the input. The schema
was then reused in the creation of subsequent schema for new
microversions and for new URIs, such as POST /allocations and the
forthcoming /reshaper.

This change fixes it by fixing the old microversion. This is the "just
fix it" option from the discussion on the associated bug. The other
option is to create a new microversion that corrects the behavior. This
is more complex than it might initially sound because of the way in

Change-Id: Ied464744803864e61a45e03c559760a8a2e2581f
Closes-Bug: #1782340
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] disallow additional fields in allocations

Back in microversion 1.12, when the allocations structure was extended
to allow project_id and user_id on PUT /allocations/{uuid},
"additionalProperties" was not set in the JSON schema, so it has been
possible since then to include unused fields in the input. The schema
was then reused in the creation of subsequent schema for new
microversions and for new URIs, such as POST /allocations and the
forthcoming /reshaper.

This change fixes it by fixing the old microversion. This is the "just
fix it" option from the discussion on the associated bug. The other
option is to create a new microversion that corrects the behavior. This
is more complex than it might initially sound because of the way in
which the original schema is used to compose new ones.

Change-Id: Ied464744803864e61a45e03c559760a8a2e2581f
Closes-Bug: #1782340

commit_message:
Update the reno for the reset_interfaces feature

This updates the release note for the 'reset_interfaces' query
parameter of a PATCH request to update a node. It clarifies that
it is a query parameter and fixes some grammatical issues.

Change-Id: I19a9e099ee4d5e9a6b4a6d49d851b5134aa02337

commit_message:
Remove "DEPRECATED" tag from Obsolete APIs

APIs which are being Obsoleted and return 410 like nova-net
only APIs, have been moved to "Obsolete API" section in api-ref.

In favour of moving them in "Obsolete API" section, "DEPRECATED"
tag on those API ref can be removed to avoid confusion whether
these APIs are deprecated or gone.

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

ref- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567682/1/api-ref/source/os-fping.inc@4

Change-Id: I47eaf08a9c06e33d707fdfe88f6771e165f377b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 10:06:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove support for /os-floating-ips-bulk REST API

Drop support for the os-floating-ips-bulk API which has been deprecated
since Newton:

  Idca478c566f9a7b5b30a3172453ce7c66d9fd8f0

This API now returns a 410 response for all routes.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample tests are just
asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference still builds
from those and can be considered more or less branchless, so people
looking at the API reference can apply it to older deployments of nova
before os-floating-ips-bulk was removed.

The release note added for previous nova-network API removals is
amended to note this additional change.

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I89d081108b398d8efba9636279088c61349b21e6

commit_message:
Remove support for /os-floating-ips-bulk REST API

Drop support for the os-floating-ips-bulk API which has been deprecated
since Newton:

  Idca478c566f9a7b5b30a3172453ce7c66d9fd8f0

This API now returns a 410 response for all routes.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample tests are just
asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference still builds
from those and can be considered more or less branchless, so people
looking at the API reference can apply it to older deployments of nova
before os-floating-ips-bulk was removed.

The release note added for previous nova-network API removals is
amended to note this additional change.

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I89d081108b398d8efba9636279088c61349b21e6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/582945

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 15:01:39.000000000', 'message': '[placement] cover bad content-length header

The main dispatch handler in placement checks to see if the
content-length header is a valid int and returns a 400 status
code if not. There had been no gabbi coverage for this behavior.
This patch adds that coverage.

Change-Id: If12fc7e374c7933bd2f10beb4be3e0a8d8e622e9
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] cover bad content-length header

The main dispatch handler in placement checks to see if the
content-length header is a valid int and returns a 400 status
code if not. There had been no gabbi coverage for this behavior.
This patch adds that coverage.

Change-Id: If12fc7e374c7933bd2f10beb4be3e0a8d8e622e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 10:37:03.000000000', 'message': "tox: Ensure reused envdirs share the same deps

In commit df669caf, we modified tox.ini to reuse a shared directory for
environments with the same dependencies. The 'venv' directory was
chosen as this seemed like a suitably generic target. However, the
'venv' target actually uses a non-default values for 'deps' as doc
requirements are included to allow things like reno using this target.
This means switching between the 'venv' target and any of the other
other targets using this directory will result in the virtualenv being
rebuilt each time.

Resolve this by using an explicit directory for these shared
environments. A single setting of 'deps' for one of the targets is
removed to make this clear.

Change-Id: I239606f5f354a5536b20b1d31ee81d80b4572106
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Ensure reused envdirs share the same deps

In commit df669caf, we modified tox.ini to reuse a shared directory for
environments with the same dependencies. The 'venv' directory was
chosen as this seemed like a suitably generic target. However, the
'venv' target actually uses a non-default values for 'deps' as doc
requirements are included to allow things like reno using this target.
This means switching between the 'venv' target and any of the other
other targets using this directory will result in the virtualenv being
rebuilt each time.

Resolve this by using an explicit directory for these shared
environments. A single setting of 'deps' for one of the targets is
removed to make this clear.

Change-Id: I239606f5f354a5536b20b1d31ee81d80b4572106

commit_message:
Update volume create schema to allow 'null'

When creating a volume from a source snapshot, size is not a required
parameter since it will be defaulted to the snapshot's original size. We
set it as not required in 8152f6c0cc0950fba33a67e62bf37e9ded7e1424, but
missed that the jsonschema validation also needed to be updated to allow
for the empty value.

Change-Id: I27b94c5579d5215fdd0fbd6c421aa5f6d9139bd8
Closes-bug: #1784821
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

docs: add info about subunit2SQL usage

This document summarizes the required subunit2SQL usage to produce
run metadata, and additional arguments this program uses in code to
display data on test results.

commit_message:
adding vxlan into Neutuon drivers for networking-ansible

Compute nodes that launch VMs will still need vxlan enabled
vxlan was left out of the enabled driver types in neutron
for the ml2-ansible environment files

Change-Id: Ib56610e403ac1e3a41cb9b65b57c40f12f7b5d54
Closes-Bug: #1783776

commit_message:
Update python-saharaclient to 1.6.0 and include patch for newer Sphinx

1.6.0 needs a backport of a fix to build with an already deprecated
part of Sphinx, so to build with Sphinx 1.7.x this patch is required

Depends-on: I0dbf9b9c574bac7b40998c8774e6882b674f3fa5
Change-Id: Ia4ceed4553ccc92886661b7893384a9b0812fa6c

subject: add publish-to-pypi to vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin
messages:
[{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-20 19:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-20 19:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

also, is your setup.cfg file setup for this correctly?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-20 21:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-20 21:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As for setup.cfg, I thought it was setup properly [1], but am still picking up some of these details.


The person who created this tempest git and PYPI project is no longer around. My best guess is they used 'vmware-nsx-tempest' in PYPI to match the python package name vmware_nsx_tempest [2]. Both of which don't match the git project name of vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin.


Please advise as to how you think it's best to move forward on this one. I'm fine with doing some renaming if it's for the best moving forward.

Thanks


[1] https://github.com/openstack/vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin/blob/master/setup.cfg
[2] https://github.com/openstack/vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin/tree/master/vmware_nsx_tempest"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-21 07:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The name variable in setup.cfg determines the pypi name - and that pypi name does not exist. I suggest to delete the wrong pypi project if you have the permissions (otherwise ask infra-root) and create a new one.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-23 17:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-31 20:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-31 20:32:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The package naming now matches the name of git/pypi project [1].
An initial release has been published to PYPI and openstackci has access [2].


Based on the previous comments I'm hoping this sets the stage to merge this patch which enables us to publish to pypi [2] via pipeline.

Also note that I'd like to investigate how to remove the old PYPI project 'vmware-nsx-tempest'.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin
[2] https://pypi.org/project/vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin/"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-31 20:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-01 04:30:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-08-02 15:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
add publish-to-pypi to vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin

This patch adds the publish-to-pypi template to the
openstack/vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin project so that we have the ability
to release versions to PYPI.

Change-Id: Id9a88fe6f8abb7aa0ddf38183313484ed3e6c361
